title: Good for a short Stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very Nice Hotel but Not Near Sites
review: Centrally located clean and very accommodating! The buffet breakfast was plentiful with many choices! The staff was very friendly and spoke English which made it much easier to obtain directions and recommendations!

title: Stayed here during the Florence Move chess tournament, amazing housekeeping staff
review: The hotel is very nice and clean.  The lobby bar and area are welcoming, especially the automated massage chair for guest use.  The only draw back is it is about a 20-25 minute walk to the city sites.  There are many restaurants very close to the hotel.

title: Perfect for our stay
review: The annual Florence Move chess tournament was held here from 1st-3rd November 2019 and players got a special rate for a room and breakfast. I had a junior suite on the 4th floor with a wooden floor, approximately 27 square metres but it felt a bit small and wasn't as spacious as it looked in the management photos. There wasn't enough space between the bed and the desk and it was a tight squeeze when sitting on the chair at the desk.  There was a huge couch with lots of cushions and on that side of the bed there was plenty of space but the TV on the wall opposite the bed didn't rotate to face the couch and the remote control was difficult to activate from the couch. The bed had two single mattresses with a mattress topper but I still noticed them and would have preferred one large mattress. However, the bed was very comfortable and so were the pillows. The wardrobe had two parts, one with hangers and the other with shelves, a safe and the minibar which had a nice selection of drinks and you get two free bottles of water every day. The Wifi worked very well throughout the hotel.  There were no individual toiletries in the bathroom which had no shelf space except for a small ledge under the mirror, just a dispenser of liquid soap and shampoo. The shampoo wasn't the best and I had to wash my long hair twice in two days. When using the bidet I had to go over to the soap dispenser first to get some liquid soap. There was a shower cap and a vanity set with cotton pads, Q tips and an emery board. There was no body lotion.  Some people complained about the noise but I didn't notice much noise.  There is a small gym in the basement with a bike, treadmill, stepper, multistation, benches and barbells which is fine for a workout.  The breakfast was alright but I hated the sugary juices and you had to pay extra if you wanted a freshly squeezed juice.  I had dinner and lunch at the hotel restaurant in the lobby and it was just alright, nothing special and the Caesar's salad with chicken for €10 was smothered in mayonnaise and not a real Caesar's salad dressing. It also just had a few slices of cheese on top instead of grated parmesan. There are some restaurants nearby either on the other side of the street towards the centre or turn right out of the hotel and walk to Via Il Prato where there are quite a few along with a laundrette and a Carrefour Express.  When you go out of the hotel turn right to go to the tram station for Tram 1 and get on on the same side as the hotel and the Torre della Serpe to go into the town centre. It's one stop to the end of the line Alamanni - Santa Maria Novella then you can either walk into the centre or get Tram 2 one more stop to the end of its line Unità. Tram 2 also goes the other way to the airport. Tickets cost €1.50 and you can buy them from the hotel reception.  The hotel is a 10 minute drive from the airport. Come out of the airport and turn right, go to the end of the building then turn right again to find the taxi stand were the prices are prominently displayed. It costs €22 during the day to go into town, €24 on a Bank Holiday and €25.30 at night (10pm - 6am) plus a supplement of €2.70 when catching a taxi from the airport and €1 per suitcase. However, beware of the drivers when paying by credit card. I took taxi Atene 18 and when we arrived at the hotel, the driver took my contactless credit card and before I knew it, he'd added €3 for paying by credit card. I insisted he gave me my €3 back in cash so before you hand over your credit card, make sure you see what the charge is and some of the taxi drivers obviously just can't help themselves (and I speak fluent Italian!).  The staff on reception were very friendly and I really have to compliment the amazing housekeeping staff who made up my room to look like new throughout my 4 night stay. It was a real pleasure to come back to a perfectly made-up room and this is one of the reasons I'm giving this hotel 5 stars.…

title: Very Nice Hotel.
review: Dear Guest,  We are glad to hear that you appreciated your stay in terms of product, quality of service, and cleanliness.  We have shared your positive impressions with all hotel staff and your kind words make us very proud. Thank you for choosing Starhotels and we hope to host you again.  Kind regards,  Laura Marina Rodio – General Manager

title: not great location, but very good hotel
review: Our third hotel with Great Rail holiday. From the station it is about a 30 minute walk or a 10 minute tram ride. Excellent breakfast on Good restaurant. Our room was clean and modern with tea and coffee and a nice clean shower, we had a small balcony on the First floor.

title: Very nice!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for choosing Starhotels Michelangelo Firenze and for highlighting our priorities in your comments, such as comfort and cleanliness of our room along with good breakfast and restaurant service.  We hope to have the pleasure of hosting you again in the next future,  Kind regards,  Laura Marina Rodio - General Manager

title: Modern Hotel, right outside the city center
review: I like this hotel, is not a high luxury hotel but they have retouch the rooms to give you that feel and receive you with a free bottle of water. The location is not very good, its like 15 minutes walking to the central train station but to walk to the center is like 20 minutes and in  the middle of the summer is not few. Although will recommend it if you get a good price and want a good room (and dont have problems with walking)

title: Nice Hotel, not in the city center
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing your views on Starhotels Michelangelo. We are happy to learn that you had a pleasant experience here. Regarding our location, we have the pleasure to inform that just in front of our buiding is possible to catch both bus or tram towards city centre.  Kind regards,  Laura Marina Rodio - General Manager

title: Modern hotel, clean and good location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Worst hotel ever!!! Michelangelo would be ashamed.
review: Contained the amenities that most Americans expect: clean, modern and the A/C worked well.   While I used to take all of these things for granted, 1 week into 2 week tour around Italy, I no longer do.  Comfortable bed, quiet room but still within walking distance (1/2 mile) from all the historic places to visit.

title: Great room...
review: Dear Guest, thank you so much for choosing Starhotels Michelangelo Firenze. We are glad to understand that your recent stay was pleasant and measured up with your expectations. Looking forward to welcoming you in Starhotels once again, kind regards  Laura Marina Rodio  - General Manager

title: Modern Hotel
review: I chose this hotel after reading reviews mainly suggesting that the hotel is clean, spacious and modern. It is NOT any of that.  1- The room is so tiny and the bathroom is even tinier!! I couldn’t place my stuff anywhere! 2- The room smelled SO bad we had to spray half of our perfumes to cover the bad smell! 3- It is not modern! It is gloomy classic and needs A LOT of maintenance ! There were scratches all over the floors and the walls. 4- The staff are not friendly or nice! They had an attitude!  5-You can’t sleep well because u hear them moving furniture ALL the time! Our stay was non- refundable, but we only were able to make it the first night. It literally felt like staying at a 2 stars motel. After only one night we had ENOUGH and we moved to another hotel.

title: Will not stay here again.
review: We stayed in the hotel as part of a large group tour.  Our room was modern and well-appointed.  The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  The hotel was not necessarily convenient to downtown.  I would not have walked to get to all of the shopping and local sites.  A taxi ride was about $10 Euros.

title: Very noisy hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice clean, spacious hotel
review: Won't come back to this hotel. Staff don't care about your relaxing.  Moving furniture that it sounds everywhere in the hotel. You can hear everything (really everything!!) from the room beside you. Location is good. Takes 20 min by foot to the downtown on the riverside.

title: Definitely not a 4 star hotel
review: The hotel is not located near the city center so walking to main attractions takes awhile but the hotel is very modern and spacious and we really enjoyed our stay.   We would definitely stay here again.

title: Comfortable, helpful staff, convenient
review: Dear Guest, thank you very much for your positive comments about Starhotels Michelangelo Florence. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back in your next stay in our Starhotels chain. Best Regards, The Management

title: Excellent Hotel With Excellent Staff.
review: +breakfast food was really okay +the design looks luxurious   -they gave us a room that had scaffolding in front of the windows. Unpleasant, but we didn’t report anything yet -on our last day, we woke up to WORKERS AT OUR WINDOW -another morning surprise was waking up to the sound of those workers doing repairs near our window -even though there were just a couple of people at breakfast, some hotel employee insisted we should sit at a certain table just for two, far away from the buffet when there were plenty of empty tables closer.   I won’t recommend, this was just a waste of money for a way below average hotel.

title: Nice, clean hotel - not located in the city center

title: Good stay and good meal
review: Overall, we had a good stay at this hotel. It was clean and the staff was very kind and helpful (especially with booking various tours of the city). However, it is not located in the city center, but is located near public transportation if you are comfortable using it! Additionally, the shower water temperature constantly fluctuated (which was frustrating). Other than that, this is a good hotel!

title: Highly recommended and as a hotel chain
review: Dear Guest, thank you so much for your review and for your signalization regarding shower temperature. Our Maintenance Dept. has immediately been involved in order to solve the issue. We look forward to welcoming you here again in the future, kind regards  Graziano Luddi  - General Manager

title: Modern and elegant
review: We decided to have a stay at Michelangelo for one night. We arrived at around 20:00 and unfortunately the hotel's parking was full. They kindly suggested us to leave the car by a parking near the hotel (only 50m). Then we had a very good dinner with some pasta very well cooked. The room was clean and there was all you need for your stay.

title: Comfortable, close to public transportation.
review: Dear Guest, It's such a pleasure to hear that your experience with us was good and we want to thank you for taking the time to write few words on Starhotels Michelangelo. We have shared your positive impressions with the restaurant staff Staff, your kind words make us very proud.  Thank you for choosing Starhotels and hoping to welcoming you again in the not so distant future.  Kind regards, Graziano Luddi

title: Good, comfortable hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Not quite the 4star
review: Stayed three nights here. Had to ask for a room change on arrival because the room window was covered with scaffolding. Changed without any problems. Room was comfortable although a little on the small side. The hotel is handy for trams and buses into central Florence and sell the tickets at reception. Breakfast adequate. Didn’t try the restaurant.

title: Not the best accommodations
review: Dear Guest,  We are glad to hear that you appreciated your stay in terms of room comfort, quality of service, and location. Thank you for choosing Starhotels and we hope to host you again.  Kind regards,  Graziano Luddi – General Manager

title: Beware Building Works
review: Stayed at this hotel for a few nights recently when visiting the beautiful city of Florence. On arrival the entrance, foyer is dark but attractive. However the dark theme continues in the rooms which although may be the design , therefore the desired effect , made the rooms too dark and lighting was inadequate, as was the storage. The breakfast was okay, but unless your choice of cooked breakfast is scrambled eggs then you would have to pay extra for an alternative. Reception and waiting staff polite and pleasant, however the Maitre d despite having no one to welcome did not offer assistance to his busy staff.Room always cleaned to a good standard. An easy walk along the river to the centre

title: Good property with professional Staff
review: We were part of a tour group so we had no say in the choice. The location was okay. The room was fine, nothing special.  The breakfast was good with the best coffee of the trip. The dinner that was included in our tour was the worst meal of our entire trip. The crepe starter was too rich, the entree horrible and the dessert inedible. Eataly better step up their game Cannot recommend staying here.

title: Very modern, spacious and welcoming
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good Hotel with friendly staff
review: Very nice hotel have just stayed there for three nights. We were at the rear of the hotel on the first floor. Room was very spacious and to a high standard. Large bathroom and well equipped. Breakfast was generally good with a wide selection of choice on offer. Although breakfast tea bags often hard to come by. Only issue we had was the noise in the morning, presume from the kitchen area or people throwing things into the bins. Otherwise very good and about twenty minutes walk from the centre.

title: Terrible
review: I would recommend this hotel.   Very friendly staff, well organised and we checked in with ease. A lovely room -with sofa to relax. Large breakfast room with many choices for breakfast - very clean and food/drink is continually stocked up. I would visit again!

title: nice hotel - warm friendly staff
review: Maybe it was a 4 star hotel long time ago, but not anymore. Don’t trust the pictures, It’s completely different from what you see in the pictures. I didn’t like the breakfast. They really need to renovate the hotel if they don’t want to loose their business.

title: Michelangelo was great!
review: We had two rooms for a two night stay here. A little out of the way but we were fine with getting the exercise and took in the nice views on our walk along the river into the main areas - 15-20 minutes away. We received a very warm greeting on arrival and we checked in alot quicker than at some other places on our journey. A large tour arrived just as we were checking in but the hotel was very organized. They handed their tour director pre organized envelopes with room keys and that crowd quickly dispersed to their rooms.   Our two rooms connected and they were a decent size. Beds were comfy and had nice linens.  The bathroom was an okay size. We couldn't see out of the room as there was scaffolding up the side of the building so that was a bit disappointing. There is a large…

title: Very nice hotel and rooms, although not centrally located
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Michelanglo
review: We stayed at the Starhotels Michelangelo as part of our tour and while the hotel had very nice, modern and spacious rooms the hotel was located on the outskirt of the city. Really the walk along the Arno was only a few minutes to get to Ponte Vecchio and other attractions but it wasn't in the center of Florence.  The hotel had a spacious bar where we watched the World Cup 2018 Final right off the lobby. The service was accommodating even though the hotel was quite busy with both several weddings and tours.  If you don't mind walking it is a great value in Florence with great rooms and good amenities.

title: Average City hotel
review: This was a nice Hotel and had a very modern style. They offered breakfast which had good selection. Many other options upon request. Within walking distance to the river and many local historical sites.

title: Good location but noisy rooms
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing your views on Starhotels Michelangelo. We are happy to learn that you had a pleasant experience here.  Hoping to have the chance to host you here once again, kind regards  Graziano Luddi - General Manager

title: Lovely stay at StarHotels
review: The hotel is situated conveniently near one of the tram stations for access to the station and from there to the northern part of Florence. It is some distance from the centre if walking. The rooms were comfortable but there is a distinct lack of wardrobe and draw space for clothes (see photo). We were a couple spending 5 nights in the hotel and had 8 hangers between us and one small draw each. This meant living out of the suitcases for most of our clothes. The reception area and "lounge" is spacious and reasonably comfortable. Breakfast is served in the dining area on the lower ground floor with a very wide choice of food available. There is a "fitness room" but I did not visit this. The average rating is perhaps a little harsh but I do not think that it can be classeed as…

title: Decent location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Wonderful rooms and the best bar tender in Italy
review: My boyfriend and I stayed here last week and though the hotel was in a good location. It is a few minutes walk away from the river, 15 mins away from the train station and 20 mins away from where lots of the attractions are.  We stayed on the 5th floor, the room was adequate and clean however it was extremely noisy at night. We had the window close but heard every ambulance (and for some reason there were a lot) going past in the early hours. The staff were not particularly helpful or welcoming. I thought the stay was slightly over priced as we stayed in cheaper accommodation in Italy with much better service.

title: A few things to improve
review: Dear Guest, thank you so much for dedicating your time to convey your views on Starhotels Michelangelo. Your comments are important and help us to improve the quality of our service.  We look forward to seeing you here again in the future,  Kind regards,  Graziano Luddi – General Manager

title: Great hotel, very nice rooms, good breakfast
review: We had a great time in Florence and Gabriel made it even better. He was at the hotel and made us feel like family and treated us so cordially. At the end of the day it was so relaxing to talk to him and enjoy his company.

title: Good modern hotel but a little out of the center
review: Dear Guest, Your review was such a delight to read! I am so pleased to hear that you appreciated the calibre of service delivered by my team, especially by Gabriele, with whom I look forward to sharing your kind words. Thank you for your comments and I look forward to seeing you again soon.  Kindest regards,  Graziano Luddi - General Manager

title: Fantastic hotel!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Disappointing
review: This hotel was lovely! Very modern and clean. There’s facilities in the room for hot drinks - this is very rare in the other hotels we have stayed in whilst travelling around Italy. The bathroom was very clean and I’ve just read a recent review about the shower which I’m surprised to read as we had no problems at all.  The breakfast was good and although we did not go I think there’s a fitness centre.  The hotel is about a 25 minute walk the the min centre where the famous bridge is.  Around the corner you can catch a C2 or a C3 bus which costs about €1- we got a ticket every time however no ones checks! This was by far the best hotel we stayed at on our travels and we will definitely stay in a starhotel again.

title: DISAPPOINTING HOTEL ON OUR HONEYMOON
review: Dear Guest, It's such a pleasure to hear that your experience with us was pleasant and we want to thank you for taking the time to write few words on Starhotels Michelangelo. We have shared your positive impressions with all hotel Staff, your kind words make us very proud. Thank you for choosing Starhotels and hoping to welcoming you again, kind regards   Graziano Luddi - General Manager

title: Beautiful stay?!
review: We booked for 5 nights a mix of business and pleasure. The staff where very good and friendly hence 3 stars. They upgraded us to a de Luxe room  still very small but adequate on the 2 nd floor. Breakfast OK but limited same EVREY day. Showers where the worst either boiling hot or ice cold ended with just having baths, complained told it was that part of the hotel had a problem!!! The room we where staying was very noisy even with 2 double glazed windows it doesn't help the hotel seems to specialise In large groups mostly from Asia and are very noisy, we did complain but we shouldn't have to just to get a good night's sleep. In general the hotel and rooms need a major revamp. I loved Florence and will he back BUT staying at  a other hotel, the location also us not great for most…

title: Could be a great hotel, if they just fix some important things!
review: Dear Guest, thank you for your comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are sorry to know that the experienced was not positive at all. Your highlighting is  important and helps us in the  improvement of our services, that we want to provide to all the guest. We  hope to welcome you again here another time.   Sincerely.   Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: Good location
review: The guys working here are great.  My daughter stayed at this hotel and left her boots behind. They have gone above and beyond to get them mailed back to us. I can't thank them enough as the boots are her favorite pair and I cannot find them anywhere to repurchase. Amazing customer service and I would like to send a special thank you to Anso.

title: Seems like a nice hotel - unfortunate experience.
review: Dear Guest, It's such a pleasure to hear that your experience with us was pleasant and we want to thank you for taking the time to write few words on Starhotels Michelangelo. We have shared your positive impressions with all hotel Staff, your kind words make us very proud. Thank you for choosing Starhotels and hoping to welcoming you again, kind regards Graziano Luddi -   General Manager

title: Very nice & centrally located
review: The hotel is clean and well maintained.  Shops are located within the area and the train station is just 10 minutes away by foot.  The breakfast selection is the same every day and not that extensive and you don’t get any information from the front desk because they don’t speak English well.  On our 2nd night we did not get any air conditioning and complained about it but it was only on our 4th night that somebody admitted that the entire hotel did not have air conditioning on anymore.  If you are particular about this, do ask before you book this hotel.

title: Excellent staff on reception
review: Dear Guest, we thank you so much for the review about your experience in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We apologize for hearing that your stay by us was not measured up with your expectations and we will take in consideration your signalization in order to improve the quality of our services. Usually the 4th of january in Italy is very cold and we have the heater on.  Best regards.   Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: Location is not that Central
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Clean and very nice rooms
review: This is a nice hotel with large rooms a nice breakfast and attractive common spaces.  The hotels location was not near any major tourist attractions and required considerable walking to reach the city center.

title: Fine business hotel
review: We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. The beds were very comfortable and the showers were great. The location is about a 15 minute walk from the main sights in Florence, or a 10 euro taxi ride. It was a quiet hotel and very comfortable. We were on a Gate 1 tour, which was a wonderful tour that I would highly recommend! I will use them again when we come back to Italy.

title: Nice and clean!
review: The hotel is mainly directed to a business customer in my opinion, with a conference center and a bit far from the center, even if it is reachable in around 15 minutes walk. The room was nice, with a cool wardrobe built as a stack of suitcases. The breakfast was nothing special, and the room where it is served (in a basement with no windows) was quite bad. Finally they should work on the internet connection, too bad for an hotel of this kind. Nice people working there.

title: Nice holiday!
review: We stayed two nights in this hotel during our Italy tour with Gate 1. The hotel is modern and very clean. Our room on a 1st floor was spacious and clean, with lovely toiletries. We had a kettle with supply of coffee and tea which was replenished by housekeeping next day. The bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately, we were could not fall asleep because of outside door banging constantly and making a very loud noise. Housekeeping was efficient. There are not enough drawers in the room or inside the closet, and only one place for a suitcase. During first night we were struggling with mosquitos and my husband had to ask front desk to spray the room. Seemed it worked. Location of the hotel is a little bit away from main attractions but not too far. There is a nice walk to the river…

title: Not a 4* hotel!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: It is not a 4* hotel
review: Had to negotiate steps with suitcases to get to reception.  Room had magnificent view of a brick wall and lots of pipes!  No bottled water in the room, No non-slip bath mat.  No WARDROBE! only a small hanging rail, only two drawers, no bedside table drawers.  Only one chair.  Only room for one suitcase - the other had to go on the chair, as we had to live out of it!  Very expensive food - don't eat there, turn right out of hotel, couple of blocks, turn right.  Great restaurant, not expensive.  Hotel is quite a way from centre.  Too far for me to walk.  Caught tram.

title: Two night Stay
review: I stayed here for 5 night and I didn't appreciate nothing. The room was old and noisy (and it was a DELUXE!) and the staff was really rude. For the price I paid, I expected a lot more. I'll never come back here!

title: Superb hotel proper 4star
review: We stayed at this hotel for two nights as part of a Gate 1 Tour. The staff were friendly, the rooms were on the large size, modern and nice bathroom. The breakfast was ok, however they didn't change the selection the next day. The location is a bit far from museums and shops. The river is about two blocks away. We walked along the river to get to the Uffizi Gallery. It was about a 25 minute walk, but a nice walk.

title: Perfect location
review: Dear Guest, thank you for your comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. Your highlighting is  important and helps us in the  improvement of our services, that we want to provide to all the guest. We  hope to welcome you again here another time. Sincerely.   Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: Staff attitude a let down and indifferent; location remote
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Mrs . Dina
review: This hotel is rated four star therefore to receive what a four star hotel should be in terms of room being nice etc is a given.  In my opinion, what makes a hotel stand out is the staff and among all hotels we stayed at in our four week Italy trip, this hotel had the worst staff attitude.  First off on arrival there wasn't any staff to open doors or assist with luggage when theirs is the most inconvenient set-up of an entrance- there is about 5 steps down from the street to reception with no ramp whatsoever for guests to comfortably wheel their suitcase in or out (I saw a young woman try to carry her 2 massive suitcases).  Then at checkin not much greeting was given.  When we got to our room, even after a note to our booking months ago of a request for a "true" double bed, quiet…

title: Clean and comfortable
review: The hotel is very near to all the major tourist places in Florence . The bus stop is a minute walk . The staff was extremely polite and helpfull. Had a pleasant and comfortable stay here . The rooms were neat  and comfortable too .

title: Tuscany now
review: Dear Guest, we thank you very much for your kind review of our hotel. We are  happy that you’ve valued positively the experience by us, both in terms of products and quality of the service, our priorities. We’ll wish to host you here soon again. Best regards. Graziano Luddi - Manager.

title: Loved our stay here
review: Front desk staff bilingual and very friendly. Got a free map with the major attractions circled. They even assisted with bus tickets and the relevant routes. Onsite parking available. Lift access. Rooms very clean and tidy bathrooms. Nice breakfast. A little out of the way of the hustle and bustle but that is exactly what we liked about the location. Trem and bus stops within a block from hotel.

title: business hotel in unpleasant area but close to tranvia
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: My favorite city - Florence
review: The rooms are very small, the service is inconsistent, I have stayed there several times for work. I had problems with double bookings, request to pay for breakfast even though it was included in the booking, problems with airco, there are often very large groups who come for seminars which causes internal traffic problems. The decoration at the entrance and the bar/restaurant is nice, but the rooms are pretty bland

title: Comfortable Stay but bad wifi
review: Thank you for your review. Best regards  manager Graziano Luddi

title: Clean spacious room, little far from attractions
review: This was my second visit to Florence. Star hotel locates within the city limit and is an 10 minutes walk to the heart of Florence. Hotel is rather new and super clean and very comfortable. It definitely deserves a 4 star plus rating.

title: Fantastic!
review: Dear Guest, we desire to thank you a lot for the positive comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. Your comments make us feel so proud and help us to do all our best to enhance the quality of our service. We are waiting for you in one of Starhotels. Best regards. Graziano Luddi – General Manager

title: Comfortable hotel on group tour of Italy
review: Stayed here with a group. Hotel and rooms had a very modern feel. For me, that meant the chair looked nice but was somewhat uncomfortable. When you walk out the front door, you're on a busy street, but not in an area with shops and restaurants; you have to walk a few blocks to get to that kind of "scene."  The provided breakfast was very comprehensive. Overall, a nice hotel but not quite an optimal experience.

title: Decent hotel in group tour
review: Dear Guest, thank you very much for spending your time in describing the stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We’ve shared with all the staff your good impressions, which help us to do always the best in our work. We’ll expecting to see you again. Best regards. Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: Ok hotel which is 15 minutes walk from the centre of Florence
review: My husband and I were impressed when we entered the hotel. The location is a very industrial area of Florence but not too far from the city center. It was definitely one of the more upscale hotels we stayed at during our tour. We were quite comfortable and the staff was friendly. The breakfast was also nice. Our room even had a balcony!

title: Decent hotel
review: Dear Guest, thank you very much for spending your time in describing the stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We’ll expecting to see you again. Best regards. Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: Perfect Located
review: Stayed here on the end of a tour with "Go Ahead Tours".  I was on the top floor, room 705 & it had a lovely view of the city & of the Duomo & the Tower of the National Museum.  The tram station is basically a few metres from the hotel.  The River Arno is about 2 blocks from the hotel.  I travelled as a single & my room was somewhat small with a queen-sized bed but was well-appointed.  The lobby is quite lovely but rather dimly lit.    While we were there we walked along the riverfront, saw a small waterfall along the way & went to the rooftop lounge of the Westin Excelsor Hotel for happy hour & a magnificent view of the city, river, it's many bridges, & the sunset.   A cocktail & some h'ordeurves was €20!  Go early as it was very busy!

title: Take your insect repellent!
review: Dear Guest, thank you very much for spending your time in describing the stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We’ve shared with all the staff your good impressions, which help us to do always the best in our work. We’ll expecting to see you again. Best regards. Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: Not impressed
review: The hotel is located in front of a tram station that takes you all around. The rooms are spacious and very clean, we were given an extra bed for our daughter at no extra cost, very cute and modern! There are a few good restaurants close.

title: Very good place
review: Dear Guest, I was so pleased to hear that you enjoyed a family stay at Starhotels Michelangelo. It is great to read that you appreciated our location and that the attention to detail from the team did not go unnoticed. Thank you for taking the time to write such kind words. We hope to welcome you again in the not so distant future. Kindest regards, Graziano Luddi

title: Not all expecatations met
review: If your look for a place to spend the night and don't care about amenities then this hotel will be fine. The food is a bit below average. Free wifi. No air conditioning. The staff is friendly. Location is walking distance to city center and other locations.

title: Nice location
review: Dear Guest, I’m glad to hear that your stay here in our Starhotels Michelangelo was pleasant and measured up with your expectations. We thank you very much for choosing us for your stay and we hope to welcome you once again in Starhotels. Sincerely. Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at
review: Loved the location of this hotel! Beautiful views!! Other positive was the breakfast! Good for a full belly:) Room was spacious and nicely equipped. Big, Super negative was the staff and expectations. We were told via our itinerary that we would receive a voucher for a drink at the bar for each traveler. We received a voucher for the lead traveler only and had to be very stern in order to receive our other drinks. Also, we were told that we would receive a complementary bottle of water each day per person. Upon arrival, no water in our room. After calling twice, we received only 1 bottle and were told that is all we would be allowed. Day 2, same story! Day 3, same story! I did not think I would need to call for my water each day and still not received what was promised.

title: Updated and very good location
review: Dear Guest, we thank you so much for the review about your experience in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We apologize for hearing that your stay by us was not measured up with your expectations and we will take in consideration your signalization in order to improve our services.  Best regards  manager  Graziano Luddi

title: Wished we could have stayed an extra night!
review: The hotel is beautiful and very well located to the Central Train Line. Rooms were very comfortable and well laid out for 3 people. We had room to place 3 suitcases (ours were large). Wish we could have stayed longer. Staff were courteous and I love that everyone is bilingual and so language is not a barrier. Thank you.

title: smells like a sewer inside , just awfu;l
review: Dear Guest, I’m glad to hear that Your stay here in our Starhotels Michelangelo was pleasant and measured up with your expectations. We are proud of it and that makes us to do always the best in our job. We thank you very much for choosing us for your stay and we hope to welcome You again in on of the hotels of Starhotels chain. Sincerely. Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: A very  comfortable, well decorated hotel with spacious  rooms
review: Stayed here on our last night of an extended vacation in Italy. Since we were flying out in the morning, we wanted something quiet, something not right in the center. This was perfect. We were a mile walk from the Duomo, walking along the Arno and cutting over from there. For us, this was a good thing--it might be a little *too* on the outskirts for those who don't care to or cannot walk a lot. Check in was quick, easy, and professional. The staff spoke English but let me speak Italian 😊 The room was not big, but not small either (and I think we had just a standard room). It was, however, *meticulously* clean, the towels were super soft (not always the case at hotels in general), and the bed was the best I slept on since we've been away from our own. There was some noise coming…

title: Beautiful modern and clean rooms, but minor issues with acoustics and Internet meant it wasn't perfect.
review: Dear Guest, thank You very much for spending your time in describing the stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We’ve shared with all the staff your good impressions, which help us to do always the best in our work. We’ll expecting to see you again. Best regards. Graziano Luddi – Manager

title: Beautiful hotel with continental breakfast
review: If you like the smell of raw sewage you will love this Hotel. From the moment you arrive in the lobby you are welcomed with a stench to rival any treatment plant. Shower has two settings - freezing cold or skin blisteringly hot. Smokers among us will feel right at home whilst breathing in the stale tobacco scented room air. unapologetic, rude and unwelcoming staff. This hotel is overpriced, underwhelming and without a doubt one of the worst I have ever stayed in.

title: Poor Customer Service
review: Dear Guest, we thank You so much for the review about your experience in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We apologize for hearing that your stay by us was not measured up with your expectations and we will take in consideration your signalization in order to improve the quality of our services. We’ll  wish to see you here again. Best regards. Graziano Luddi– Manager

title: Good location and very attentive staff
review: The hotel is very nice, but not as clean as newer places. Continental breakfast is good, but let's be honest, lunch and dinner is what Italians excel at. Service is fine, but the main selling point is the hotel's central location.

title: Excellent
review: Dear Guest, I’m glad to hear that Your stay here in our Starhotels Michelangelo was pleasant and measured up with your expectations. title: Incredible!
review: I must admit, florence wasn't what I expected on my walk there from the station. I'd come from Milan which seemed like a mini London to me, the part of florence i visited didn't have much going on, we went for a wedding, and although the venue and nearby river were stunning, this hotel was the highlight of my trip. The minibar to the comfortable beds and air conditioning, to the great service with the staff and the overall ambience, I'd definitely come back. Three of us spaciously fit into a double bed, the bathroom is also lovely and very very spacious and even luxurious. Quality stay and not a single mosquito in sight. Great bar also and restaurant, and very quiet hotel

title: Incredible!
review: Dear Guest, we thank You very much for your kind review of our hotel. We are  happy that you’ve valued positively the experience by us, both in terms of products and quality of the service, our priorities. We’ll wish to host You here soon again Best regards. Alessandra Bragoli - Manager.

title: Comfortable stay
review: What an absolutely unbelievable hotel. We stayed here for 1 night and I couldn't express how amazing this was. We were able to walk in and out of Florence so easily -  no need for a taxi or anything!  We arrived super early but the receptionist said there was a room available for us if we wanted to check in. Which was great because we were bale to relax and rest for an hour before exploring!  Room was divine and so comfy. The breakfast was all you can eat so you could stock up for your day!

title: comfortable and expensive
review: Dear Guest, I thank You a lot for the positive comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo, also in the name of our Staff. Your comment makes us feel so proud that we’ll absolutely enhance the quality our service. We are waiting for You in one of our hotels of the chain. Sincerely  Alessandra Bragoli

title: Comfortable Stay, Good location!
review: I enjoyed staying in this hotel very much.  It was clean, it was spacious.  The beds were comfortable and the sheets were soft.  Many of the sites are within walking distance and Florence is breathtaking.

title: Great place to stay!
review: Dear Guest,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your recent stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are really glad to hear that you appreciated our hospitality, in terms of quality of the service/product, location and cleanliness. Any suggestions or opinions related to our service is highly taken into consideration and, if in any way this service can be improved, be well assured that our will is to achieve this goal. Thank you for choosing Starhotels and hoping to welcoming you again, kind regards. Alessandra Bragoli - General Manager

title: Robbed in the basement level breakfast room
review: We stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights with a bicycle tour group. We walked from the Train station to the Hotel which was probably a good half mile on rough sidewalks and streets with luggage which is doable if you are strong and traveling lightly. We had a 70 lb bike case and large suitcases so it was a bit of a struggle! I really liked the location even though it is outside of the area of most attractions.  It is still a lovely 3 bridge walk to get closer to the famous attractions but I liked being away from the crowds at night. The rooms are modern and well equipped. The bathroom was very clean, modern, but little space for toiletry bags for two people. We had a nice view of a park, light rail system and Sunsets. The windows open for fresh air! There are small stores nearby for…

title: Excellent Stay in Florence
review: Dear Guest,  We would like to thank you for sharing your thoughtful comments, following your recent stay at Starhotels Michelangelo.We are very pleased to learn you enjoyed many aspects of your recent stay, in terms of quality of service and product, location and cleanliness. Any suggestion is highly taken into consideration in order to improve the quality of the service we deliver to all our Guests. I will share your words of appreciation with the team and we look forward to welcoming you again soon. Kind regards, Alessandra Bragoli – General Manager.

title: Modern hotel with immaculate rooms and great breakfast
review: We stayed at the Starhotels Michelangelo for 4 nights while in Florence. This hotel was very nice. Very clean, modern and updated interiors. Centrally located, layout of the room and bathroom was nice, however their towels are very old! It did not fit at all with the hotel. My mom asked for newer towels but was given the same older looking ones. This hotel needs to invest in new towels. However, the service was quite great! The rooms were always cleaned well. The front office staff were always ready to answer questions and make reservations for you. It was my dad's 70th birthday and we told them, the next day they gave us a cake and champagne for him! Special mention to the head of breakfast, sorry I did not get your name, Sir, thank you for your kind accomodation. Great staff…

title: good staff
review: Dear Guest,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your recent stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are really glad to hear that you appreciated our hospitality, in terms of quality of service and product, location and cleanliness. Any suggestions or opinions related to our service is highly taken into consideration and, if in any way this service can be improved, be well assured that our will is to achieve this goal.  I was immensely pleased to learn that individual team members helped create such a memorable and enjoyable experience for you, and I look forward to sharing your kind words of appreciation personally with our Staff and with Carmelo, the head of breakfast. Thank you for choosing Starhotels and hoping to welcoming you again in the near future, kind regards. Alessandra Bragoli - General Manager

title: Good Service.
review: We stayed here for 2 nights in September and were pleased to see how clean and modern this hotel is.  Our room was large with a nice size bathroom.  There was a safe for our use and plenty of towels for the bath.  AC worked very well.  Breakfast was more than ample. This hotel is located on a quiet street with a couple of restaurants within walking distance.  If you are looking to be located in the very heart of Florence, this hotel will not be for you as it might require that you walk a distance or take a cab to reach tourists areas.

title: Perfect on every level
review: Dear Guest, Your review was such a delight to read! I am so pleased to hear that you appreciated the calibre of service delivered by my team and enjoyed a comfortable nights sleep in our Starhotels Michelangelo. Thank you for your comments and I look forward to seeing you again soon. Kindest regards, Alessandra Bragoli - General Manager

title: Very nice hotel!

title: Nice location, comfortable
review: By reading reviews beforehand, I was pleasantly surprised with my experience at the Starhotels Michelangelo Firenze.  Although not centrally located it was easily accessible by public transportation and not far from the city center (if you were up for a walk).  The hotel was decorated nicely and I was pleased with the spaciousness and layout of my room.  The breakfast was just average, what you'd expect for a continental breakfast.  The front desk staff were efficient and helpful if asked a question but did not go above and beyond. The breakfast room staff were very friendly and accomodating.  It does take a minute to get used to the low light level in the lobby but the complimentary fruit infused water was a welcome touch after a day out in the hot sun.  The fitness room was…

title: Good location
review: Dear Guest,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your recent stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. title: Worst hotel I've ever been in!
review: Family of five, enjoyed our stay here. Location was nice, very close to the Arno river,  convenient, not a bad walk anywhere! Rooms were clean, modern, roomy and very quiet! Breakfast perfect for our family. Would stay here again.

title: Definitely Would Not Recommend This Hotel
review: Dear Guest, I was so pleased to hear that you all enjoyed a family stay at Starhotels Michelangelo. It is great to read that you appreciated our location and that the attention to detail from the team did not go unnoticed. We pride ourselves on being a family friendly hotel and are so glad your family had an enjoyable stay. Thank you for taking the time to write and look forward to welcoming you back in the not so distant future. Kindest regards,  Alessandra Bragoli - General Manager

title: Unfriendly welcome and front desk continued to be aloof

title: Nice hotel
review: The general level of service means a good hotel becomes an average one. We arrived after a long journey by car exacerbated by Florence's one way system which means it is easy to waste ime circling round the hotel to try and access it if you do not have an up to date sat nav. We were welcomed by an aloof and unfriendly front desk who seemed to think they were belonged to a byegone era when only the right clients get service Florence is expensive to park so we ended up paying to park at the equally expensive hotel car park. The car park opposite was not recommended by the hotel  Hotel itself is outside the city but it is a pleasant 20 minute walk away only along the river Hotel itself was largely pleasant and surprisingly quiet- I had to ask them to switch lights on in the small…

title: Simply 'modern'
review: Dear Guest, I was most disappointed to learn that we failed to extend the high standards of service, attention to detail and professional courtesy expected by our guests and that we were unable to satisfactorily address and recover these shortfalls during your sojourn. I truly appreciate you taking the time to bring your concerns to my attention and completely understand that these shortfalls detracted from the enjoyment of your visit. Whilst I am unable to turn back the clock, I hope you will accept my assurance that your experience is not typical and should you ever consider staying with us in future, I would be grateful if you would contact me directly, so I may ensure we have the opportunity to fully restore your image of Starhotels Michelangelo. With all good wishes, Alessandra Bragoli - General Manager

title: Early June Showers In Firenze
review: Nice quite hotel located in the edge of the center area. Rooms were Ok ,clean and staff were nice and helpful especially Lura,She was very nice,helpful and cheerful.The only thing i did not like is that the location on the map(GPS) was not accurate and I told them that so they can fix it.

title: Very nice hotel
review: Dear Guest, Your review was such a delight to read! I am so pleased to hear that you appreciated the calibre of service delivered by my team, especially Lara, who personally thanks you for your nice words. I am also glad you enjoyed a comfortable nights sleep in one of our rooms. We appreciate you told us about the wrong location on the GPS map, be well assured that this has been taken into consideration.  Thank you for taking the time to write and look forward to welcoming you back in the not so distant future. Alessandra Bragoli

title: Wonderful surprise room 310
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: NO AIR CONDITION
review: My family of 4, had booked a room, and spent two nights at this hotel from the evening of July 13 to the morning of July 14. It's an excellent hotel for the price, so full marks here. It's also spotlessly clean and well maintained. We stayed in room 310 It's a decent sized room with a comfortable double bed. The window fittings were firm which helps to cut noise, It's actually very quiet around. The decor had a fair deal of old world charm too. The best area was the dinning/bar area. The decor here is rather simple but the ambience is very elegant. And now the best part: The breakfast is just awesome. It may not appear so at first look, but believe me, the spread is substantial, cooked with care and very tasty. Carmelo who was I front supervising the dining area take excellent…

title: Perfect
review: Dear Guest, we thank You very much for your kind review of our hotel. We are  happy that you’ve valued positively the experience by us, both in terms of products and quality of the service, our priorities. Alessandra Bragoli - Manager.

title: Great stay
review: This hotel is remodeled and clean but do NOT fall for the air conditioning advertisement.  They suggest they have air conditioning in the rooms.  There is one little vent that blows out HOT air.  I was up the entire night.  Had 5 maintenance people in our room which was a show.  The main reason it doesn't work is because the front desk reception area controls all the temperature levels.  When you leave your room...they shut off the air conditioning.  When you come back after a long day of being out touring and sightseeing...you come back to a boiling hot room.  I had to sleep with cold rags and water bottles all over me just to try to stay cool.  I spoke to management several times and they did NOTHING about it.  Just a caution if air conditioning is important to you.  Prior to…

review: Dear Guest, we thank You so much for the review about your experience in our Starhotels Michelangelo. title: Great hotel in Florence
review: On the approach, the Starhotel Michelangelo does not look much like a hotel - more like an office building. The entrance is on the corner so the door are at a 45 degree angle to the street and walking in the lobby opens before you, with whimsical touches of the 60s - note: this is intentional and now becoming quite the trend. Some other reviewers apparently aren't aware of this. The reception area steps down into a large room with multiple sofas that are very comfortable and provide a good place to wait for others. There is another smaller room that has one of the really high end massage chairs - this is adjacent to the small bar and restaurant. The night we arrived they were having a happy hour and had put out a few items for patrons to snack on.  The rooms were among the most…

title: Quiet and Restful
review: thank you very much for our review. Best regards Alessandra Bragoli

title: Lovely spot
review: Great Hotel in Florence. The outside of the building does not look like much but the rooms are amazing. The Hotel lobby is a bit retro but very cool. Gabriel and others at front desk are very helpful with recommendations. Really loved it and would go back.

title: Average
review: thank you very much for your kind review .we hope to welcome You again in on of the hotels of Starhotels chain. Sincerely. Alessandra Bragoli – Manager

title: Very average, actually a bit disappointing.
review: A bit far of a walk from the train station.  Doable but awkward with luggage - just far enough for a taxi probably if you have heavy luggage.  Excellent value.  Great rooms.  Don't bother with breakfast.  Close to river - solid 15-20 minute walk from central Florence (e.g. Duomo) but good way to start and end your day.

title: Lovely  hotel
review: Thank you for your kind review. Best regards Alessandra Bragoli Manager

title: Excellent location still in a quiet surrounding.
review: In plus - staff was very friendly and polite. We asked to change room several times and although they did not know how to fix 'loud sound in the rooms' issue we had they always proposed another room - location is quite good - very nice lobby   in minus: -paper thin walls. You can here everything that your neighbours or people on corridors are doing. I mean everything. - very poor breakfast. They have nice restaurant but breakfast choice is again very poor (1-2 kinds of cheeses, 1-2 kinds of ham of not great quality, no fresh veg at all, no hot tea!! etc). On the top of that even that poor food was not being re-filled in a timely manner. - we had to change our room 3 times before we got a room with no loud buzzing (funny thing is that no staff were able to say where is the buzz…

title: Quiet, clean, and comfortable, but basic
review: Dear Guest, thank You for your comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are sorry to know that the experienced was not positive at all. title: Great night's sleep
review: Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean nice sized rooms; lovely linen, towels and powerful shower. Nicely appointed and designed rooms. Quiet and well equipment. Close enough to centre of Florence to walk everywhere far enough out to be away from the madding crowds. Enjoyed our stay; breakfast could have a little more zip to it would be only critique.

title: Friendly, Helpful staff in a clean modern hotel close to the Arno River
review: A modern and comfortable mid sized hotel located in a quiet spot, a block from the Arno River - an easy walk from the Ponte Vecchio.  Modern appointments, impeccably clean.  Front desk staff helpful.  Great night's sleep.  Breakfast included in my room rate.  Short walk to several outstanding dining options.

title: good hotel... bit far
review: We spent ten nights in Italy on a tour with stops in Rome, Sienna, Florence, Venice and Milan and this hotel was clearly the best.  We liked the rooms, especially the bathrooms. Breakfasts were excellent.

title: A bit far from attractions but great hotel
review: Dear Guest, I’m glad to hear that your stay here in our Starhotels Michelangelo was pleasant and measured up with your expectations. title: Business Hotel
review: very good hotel to book in Florence, clean and tidy rooms, very helpful and friendly staff, breakfast wasn't the best as in food quality and buffet location, bit of a walk or transportation needed to visit city attractions and shops

title: Don't open the windows!!
review: Yhank you for your kind review, we take note for the breakfast buffet.  Best regards  Gaetano gatti

title: Impossible to sleep : no air-con and lots of mosquitoes! Poor service
review: We stayed 3 nights in October and had a very please experience.  The hotel is modern and our bath even had a tub!  It was very clean and staff was very pleasant.  The bed was very firm but is typical of Europe.  I will say the location is not central but its easy to catch the bus right down the street.  We even walked home one night and so its not too far.  Wifi was average.  The breakfast was good but the eggs seamed to be powdered so i'd skip those.

title: Stylish hotel with an Italian finish
review: Thank you for your kind review. Best Ragrds Gaetano Gatti Manager

title: Clean but not great or welcoming
review: Reading another review complaining about the same, I realise I am not the only one who has suffered a sleepless night. The manager answered to that review but they decided to do nothing about it! To the manager : there are those anti mosquito devices that you can plug and last all night, even with the windows open. How come only a smelly spray is offered as a solution to the customers? How come you didn't buy some of these devices? They're very cheap! You definitely don't care about your customers, this is so easy to fix.  We were only given an spray, that lasted nothing with the windows open (impossible to sleep otherwise, since it was so warm, and no air-con!), and mosquitoes were coming again and again.   Then there was the breakfast... In other hotels, when they say that the…

title: Pleasant stay in Florence
review: Incredible and so close to town. If you arrive at main train station your 2 stops on the new tram away or within walking distance. this hotel is about 1/2 mile if that from river to walk along it, and only a mile from downtown area of florence. We felt very safe walking at night. The staff was incredible helping with bookings of tours and where to go. The breakfast was well the same at every hotel not awesome however fruit, yoghurt is a great way to start your day. the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We got lucky with this hotel and would stay again and recommend to anyone.

title: Great stay
review: Dear Guest, we thank you very much for your kind review of our hotel. We are  happy that you’ve valued positively the experience by us, both in terms of products and quality of the service, our priorities. We’ll wish to host you here soon again. Best regards. Gaetano Gatti - Manager.

title: Modern Hotel with Good Transport Links
review: Hotel was good, rooms were nice and clean, location was not in the center, though getting to the city center is not far and pretty easy. Free wifi was good, staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was also pretty standard. It was a good stay, no complaints.

title: Nice place on outskirts of tourist attractions
review: Nice modern luxury hotel. Lovely foyer mostly nice staff, with the exception or one desk manager who being technically challenged was unable to charge my credit card correctly and almost refused to give us our pre booked room,even though it was 11.30PM at night and my 1&3 yr old children were falling out of their standing wanting to sleep.He did eventually apologise after yelling at us that it was impossible.

title: Ideally Suited to Tour Groups
review: Dear Guest, thank You for your comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are sorry for the incovenience, by the way we need a credit card in order to guarantee all the reservations we have. The receptionist asked you a credit card at your arrival (very late in the evening) as per our procedure, because we receipted your reservation without it.  We  hope to welcome you again here another time. Sincerely. Gaetano Gatti – Manager

title: Highly recommend
review: We were part of a tour so no issues checking in or out.  The lobby is nice and breakfast was OK.  Lots of pastries and cheese.  No hard boiled eggs but they were able to accommodate gluten allergies.  Rooms were nice and modernly furnished.  Free wifi but no washcloths (take note American travelers!) We were near the water but not on it so no real place at the hotel to go and enjoy being outside with a view that I saw.  It was a pretty good walk to get to the Duomo and the Uffizi, but if you're a walker it's not a problem.  Service was OK.  I was able to get change at the front desk but my Aunt asked the next day and they said they couldn't do it- so you be the judge!  Nice places to eat around the hotel and I never felt unsafe walking around in the area.

title: Nice Hotel
review: thank you for your kind riview. Best regards Gaetano Gatti Manager

title: Not bad - but nothing standout

title: Great location
review: Is a decent hotel, about 15 minutes by cab from the Florence Train station and is not too far away (about 30 mins walk) from the sights - Uffizi, Bridge-Pente Vecchio etc. Breakfast is reasonable, housekeeping efficient, room was averagely large (we only look for hotels with rooms larger than 20m/200 sq ft and this was) Since we were midway in our trip we were keen for a laundrette nearby and 5 minutes walk was one - also next to it is a Carrefour and some really nice restaurants. We'd booked the hotel about 2 months prior to trip so got a decent rate (though still quite expensive when compared to Rome), however the rack rate running at the hotel when we checked in was more than double what we paid...and at that price it is just not worth the stay...there are many more hotels…

title: Nice Hotel in Nice Firenze
review: Dear Guest, thank You for your comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are sorry to know that the experienced was not positive at all. Gaetano Gatti – Manager

title: Highly recommended!
review: Stayed at this hotel with a group of friends, very helpfull front desk team they were always helpfull with transport; suggestions and also helped with wifi  Breakfast was great in the mornings room very nice and clean with addition of great coffee.  Great location only 10 minutes walk from centre to the hotel, train station and shops close by.

title: Trip to Florance
review: We were booked into this comfortable 4 star hotel with a group tour. The décor is contemporary, the spacious lobby is on several levels, and the room was large, well equipped and quiet. It's about a 15 minute walk from the popular attractions in Florence., but the footsore traveler can take a cab back, as we did. The staff made a special effort to locate and return a personal item that had been left behind in the breakfast room.

title: holiday

title: Great, Clean Hotel in Florence
review: We stayed at starhotels Michelangelo in October 2014 the hotel is nice but the location is a bit far from the attractions, the room was average size the reception staff were nice, breakfast was included but was terrible nothing exciting about it and very low quality and cheap and to top it up the breakfast are staff were not happy to see the guests, they couldn't be bothered to welcome the staff, specially the floor manager! Overal good hotel but don't get have breakfast

title: Lovely hotel within 15 minutes of city centre

title: Cute hotel at the edge of town
review: We stayed here for 2 nights during a recent trip through Italy. After a very uncomfortable 2 nights in Venice, this was a welcome surprise.  The room was quiet, quite large and surprisingly modern. It is located a bit of a walk from the Duomo, Ponte Vecchio, etc. so that was a bit of a negative. The breakfast buffet was good, but also limited relative to other hotels that we experienced during this trip.

title: 2 nights in fForence
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for dedicating your time to share your experience at Starhotels Michelangelo. We are glad to hear that your experience at our hotel was positive and that our standards have surprised you. We make a great effort to ensure that we meet our guest expectations.  Hoping to welcome you soon in one of our Starhotels,  Kind Regards, Gaetano Gatti General Manager

title: Thought it would be better
review: Starhotels was the first hotel stop in our tour of Italy. Its set a great tone for the trip. Our rooms were great and the overall hotel was nice, cute and modern. Great service by staff on all levels- from the bartender to front desk to the breakfast wait staff. The hotel offered free breakfast every morning which was a great spread. Only cons: there is one iron for the entire hotel (which is quite comical) and the wifi SUCKS!  Otherwise it was a great stay!

title: Very nice room, small details need to be fixed.
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing your experience of Starhotels Michelangelo. I am glad to hear that your experience was overall positive. Your feedback helps us and it is really crutial in order to improve the quality of our service and I am happy to share with you that we have increased the number of irons in the hotel.  Hoping to welcome you soon in one of our Starhotels,  Kind Regards, Gaetano Gatti

title: Easy, comfortable hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Not Bad For A Boutique Hotel
review: Definitely the most comfortable bed I've ever had in any hotel! Big, clean, firm, felt great!!!  Spacious room, clean. Well fitted bathroom, clean, everything you need.  Breakfast was included, but cold bacon and cold scrambled eggs don't cut it for me.... why not have someone make them fresh for those who want it? Rest of breakfast is fine, fresh fruit (important!), good rolls and croissants, good cereal selection and very good coffee.  Nice bar though I would suggest they either change the video on the big TV screen, it becomes really boring really quickly, or turn the thing off entirely. It serves no purpose once you've seen the ad for the Starhotels about 50 times in an hour. And because the screen is over the fireplace, you are drawn to look at it.... Reception fine,…

title: Nice stay
review: Dear Guest, we desire to thank you for the time you dedicated for us with your kind feedback. Comments and suggestions of our guests are really appreciated and help us to improve the quality of our services. Hoping to welcome you here again, best regards,  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: Updated hotel but a few glitches
review: Location of the hotel is definitely not central , so don't expect lots of shops , convenience stores or pizzeria nearby. There is however, a bus and a tram station near the hotel , which would be advantageous for local residents who are on a mini vacation. Lobby is small , but it was beautiful . It has subdued lighting , but somehow you could feel the tranquility of the place. The room  is quite small for my standards, but expected for European hotels. Yet it is still functional, and provides the basic necessities . And worth mentioning is the nice bathroom, flat screen television and comfortable king sized bed for me and my spouse. Wireless internet is complimentary, and fairly fast enough to catch up with my e-mails and social media networks. Breakfast is served buffet style,…

title: Predictable quality
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Close to Firenze Airport
review: Elegance and comfort, convenient location and professional service. That’s what we expect when booking our stay with the Starhotels, a small group of Italian family run hotels originating here, in Florence. Classic design with contemporary touch, spacious yet cosy lobby where you can always find a place for yourself. Catch up on calls, or just relax browsing their selection of travel, art and design books. There is a small bar, and the coffee is really good too.

title: Convenient Location and Spacious Rooms
review: Dear Guest, thank you for the time you spent to convey your views about Starhotels Michelangelo Firenze. It is a great pleasure to hear that your expectations were satisfied. These kind words motivates us to reach our high standards day by day. Hoping to welcome you very soon in one of our Starhotels, Kind Regards  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: A nice stay
review: We stayed here for one night, as we were to fly out of Firenze. We arrived from Siena to Firenze's train station, took a short taxi ride and arrived at this hotel two hours earlier than check in time. The staff accommodated us as they had an available room-which was a pleasant surprise.  This is a modern hotel, large, with a bar and exercise room. Front desk staff were courteous, multi-lingual, and took time to answer questions about restaurants and sites nearby. A tram was conveniently in front of the hotel and it was a short ride to San Lorenzo marketplace.  Room was very spacious, modern decor, couch, and amenities. The surrounding area was quiet and mostly residential. I would stay here again.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for the kind words you shared on Starhotels Michelangelo. We are glad to hear that you have appreciated both the quality and the service of the hotel: our priorities. The positive experience you shared make us proud of our property and company.  Thank you for choosing us and hoping to welcome you soon in one of our properties, Best regards  Gaetano Gatti General Manager

title: MEMORIES SAVED
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: A bit noisy
review: I want say that I am very impressed with your hotel staff and their service.  I received my Painting in its Tub in excellent condition and In less than a week after leaving it there by mistake. We were able to save our memories through this hand painted canvas. I highly recommend your hotel & staff anytime.  Your professionalism is impressive, it made a huge difference on our vacation and memories. Regards, Santia Pons

title: Can't sleep here in November!
review: Dear Guest, thank you for the time dedicated to write a review of your recent stay with us, we are really glad to realize that you have been impressed by our service. We have shared your positive impressions with all hotel Staff, your kind words make us very proud. Hoping to welcoming you again in Starhotels, best regards,  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: Nice Accomodations
review: Well located hotel. Room is simple but a bit noisy due its proximity with the lift. Staff was polite and provided proper info about transport, landmarks and available for any request. There are 2 bus lines close to the hotel that connects to the downtown.

title: Super convenient
review: Dear Guest, thank you for your comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are sorry to know that the experienced was not positive at all, due to noise in the room. Your highlighting is important for us and will help in the improvement of our services. We hope to welcome you again in Starhotels.  Best regards,  Gaetano Gatti – General Manager

title: Pleasant Surprise
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: It started in a wrong way...
review: Clean and modern this hotel definitely surprised me with its superior quality ideal for business travelers.  This hotel seems to be geared towards large groups and conferences.  I would not particularly recommend it for families or couples.  Not centrally located, but rather close to the convention area.  For tourists looking for shops, galleries, sites, and restaurants - this is not an ideal area and not the nicest part of town.  However, the hotel amenities are nice.  I did have to drag  my suitcases into the hotel.

title: Really nice Hotel
review: Dear Guest, first of all thank you for the time spent on giving us a feedback. It is really a pleasure for us to hear that we met your expectations in terms of cleanness and facilities. We deeply apologize for the inconvenience occured with your suitcases. In the Lobby a Poter is alwaiys at disposal to help Guests with luggage, probably at your check-in he was delivering someone else bags. Your comments are really important, helping us to improve the quality of our service. We hope to welcome you again in Starhotels, Kind Regards,  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: When I came receptionist said "We have a problem for your first night..." - due to overbooking. And of course, I wasn't very happy. OK, it happens, I expected a nightmare but at the end it was great how they managed it. I was personally taken by porter to the hotel in the neighborhood , got free parking for my car and they upgraded my double room into junior suit when I came back next night. Instead of "lousy" my rating was changed by their actions into "excellent" - problems can happen in any kind of business, the way of managing them make distinction between bad and good.

title: Wonderful Hotel.
review: Dear Guest, first of all we want to thank you for sharing your impressions on your recent stay with us and for the kind comments about our service . We are really sorry for the unusual unfortunate inconvenience occurred during your check-in but it's a great pleasure for us to come to know that you anyway appreciated the attention our Staff gave you on arrival.  We sincerely thank you for your time you dedicated to us and hope to have the possibility of welcoming you once again in Starhotels. Best regards  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: Comfortable and modern hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace.
