title: Nice Hotel
review: We stayed here on a Globus tour.  The room was comfortable.  The facilities were good.  We found, however, that it was a little too far out of the city centre for us.  We moved on to another hotel right in the middle of the city next to the Duomo.   The cost was considerably more but it was worth doing.

title: Worst hotel based on service in all of my travels to Europe
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for the your time spent to convey your views about Starhotels Michelangelo Firenze. Your feedback helps us to understand the perceptions of our guests. It a priority for us to meet  your expectations and we are glad to understand, despite our distance from city centre, that our service and facilities got your satisfaction. We sincerely hope to welcome you again in Starhotels in the future, Kind regards,  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: Good hotel, close to the train station but service was lacking
review: The staff wasn't super friendly, but the room was very spacious and clean. The location wasn't the best, but by taxi it was pretty close to things. There isn't a whole lot to do in the neighborhood. Also, the food at the hotel was only average. However, if you need to catch a train or want to stay at a nice hotel on a budget this is a great hotel for it!

title: Nice hotel, but not best location
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for spending your time to write about our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are glad to hear that you have enjoyed your stay with us, even if we were not able to impress you at all. Your comment really helps us to understand the perceptions of the guests and to find the right way to improve. Hoping to welcoming you again in Starhotels, Best regards  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: Tough review to write...Lots of + but the small (-) make it a 3 * experience
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great location and average services
review: So off the bat, the location isn't bad at all. 15 minute walk from the station, and 20-25 minutes to the center. The walk through to the center is through the cool neighborhood with cafes and good restaurants all over. The quality of the hotel room is great with premium fixtures and bedding. The rooms on floor 1 are larger than the rest, and should be requested.  The breakfast as per other reviews is terrible. They really need to do something about this. Scrambled eggs made from egg beaters, no fresh juice and stale coffee. YUCK!.   Now the bad parts. Hotel staff control the room temperature from the front desk, and the AC in the rooms leaves a lot to b desired for. I am an industrial engineer, and I know they were not running the AC at capacity. We even had to change rooms…

title: Loved this Hotel
review: Dear Guest, Thank you, first of all, for finding the time to write this review, any suggestions or opinions related to our service is highly taken into consideration. We understand what you had experienced during your stay was unpleasant and want to apologize for this. We have carefully verified all the details involved with all our Staff, and work to better offer customer satisfaction and an impeccable service. The inconveniences occurred are very regrettable and we will do our utmost to avoid similar situation in the future.      Hoping to welcoming you again in Starhotels,  Kind Regards,  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: Ideal apart from breakfast
review: We stayed in the hotel 3 nights during our visit to florenc The Hotel location was great as it is 10 min walk to the city Center, also the same to the rever. There was only 2 restaurants which are 5 min walk The rooms were adequate for couples but we faced problem with the availability of soup and shampoo which we requested many times with no reply!! This really annoyed us The breakfast was poor even no toast bread was available during our stay We found that the star Hotel chain is only decent and not worth the money paid ( we also stayed in the same chain in Milano due to the reservation done by our travel agent) To be honest the triple room was spacious and have more facilities

title: Breakfast service was a total mess.
review: Dear Guest, thank you for your comment regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. Your highlighting relating our service is important and, if in any way this service can be improved, be well assured that our will is to achieve this goal. We are really sorry to hear that you were not impressed by our services, we think that the problems you refer about bath amenities in the room and toasted bread at breakfast are isolated accidents and we will do all our best to avoid this kind of inconveniences for the future. We  hope to welcome you again in Starhotels, Best regards  Gaetano Gatti – General Manager

title: 4 beds in 1 room is not a family room
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Decent clean rooms, free wifi in rooms but weird breakfast set-up
review: Hotel pictures suggest 2 rooms for a family room. In reality 4 beds are placed in a standard room (sofabed + extrabed). Apparently business travellers do not require privacy when travelling with their family. Not really funny.  The airco is not up to its job.

title: Modern rooms but dreadful service.
review: Dear Guest,  we thank you for taking the time to write your experience in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We are really sorry to understand that your stay was not measured up with your expectations. Our family rooms as per our site are huge rooms with sofa bed where an extra bed can be easily fitted. We thank you again for your review and wish to see you here again in Starhotels.  Best regards.  Gaetano Gatti – General Manager

title: A modern hotel with a classic touch
review: We stayed here for a couple of nights for a sightseeing trip at the beginning of August. The hotel has a lovely reception area. It was quite dark and cool, which was pleasant after the hike from the station (only about 15 minutes, but it was very warm and sticky). The reception staff were professional and welcoming. The location of the hotel is okay: only about 20 minutes walk from the centre. Not the most gorgeous area, but you get what you pay for in terms of the room which was of a reasonable size for Florence and quite modern and clean. We had asked for a quiet room away from the lifts, which the staff honoured. It was very quiet with the windows shut. Unfortunately, the staff cannot predict the antisocial behaviour of your neighbours and so we were rudely awoken by the…

title: Wonderful modern hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you, first of all, for finding the time to write your review on Starhotels Michelangelo, it is really important for us to listen to the feedback of our Guest in order to improve our service. We deeply apologize for the inconveniences occurred during breakfast time, we have met the breakfast management and highlighted the different issues you have spotted. We did our best to solve these problems and decided for a new organization of breakfast staff, to be sure that matters like those you have reported will never happen again in the future. Our Guest satisfaction is our priority and we regret when we don't achieve what we aim at.  Hoping to see you soon in Starhotels,  Best regards,  Geatano Gatti  - General Manager

title: Good location, Nice place to stay
review: My husband and two teens stayed here 3 nights as part of a Globus tour package. This was a very nice option in Florence; maybe our favorite of the trip. We were able to get two adjoining rooms, which was nice.The rooms were very modern and sleek, but on the small side, which was fine. There were many things within walking distance...the ponte vecchio bridge, restaurants and shops. Very comfortable beds and bathroom facilities, very clean, and courteous employees.

title: Adequate, but lacked ambience
review: Dear Guest,  we are glad to hear that your stay here in our Starhotels Michelangelo was pleasant and measured up with your expectations. We are proud of it and that makes us to do always the best in our job. We thank you very much for choosing us for your stay and we hope to welcome you and your family once again in Starhotels.   Best regards, Gaetano Gatti – General Manager

title: Neat hotel in central location
review: We had 2 rooms & had stayed from 13/7 to 15/7. the room were neat & clean, the staff was helpful, Tram station is very close 1 min walk & 15 min walk to the main station, breakfast spread was good, overall good experience to stay at this hotel

title: Sexy modern hotel a bit out of town
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Excellent Hotel - Location only (slight) negative
review: Great hotel with an ultramodern, lowlit lobby that makes you feel like James Bond and a great breakfast. A bit of a walk to the important sites of the historical center but the city bus C this departs from practically outside takes you there in just a few minutes. Ideally placed for Fortezza da Basso, Cascine. The rooms are generously sized and very comfortable. The wifi had major problems when I was there which compromised work I had to do, though.

title: Great Place in Florence
review: Dear Guest,  thank you very much for spending your time in describing the stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We’ve shared with all the staff your good impressions and comments, which help us to do always the best in our work. We’ll expecting to see you again.   Best regards.  Gaetano Gatti – General Manager

title: Nice place. Nice location. Nice buy!
review: Stayed here during business for 3 nights in June 2014.  From the outside, the hotel leaves a lot to be desired and doesn't present the best vibe.  However, the inside and especially the rooms, more than make up for it.  Friendly staff, very large room with modern amenities, a King bed, a sitting area, and a Huge bathroom.  Breakfast was European standard; staff was very friendly - special kudos to the bartender.     Only negative is the hotel is quite a walk away from city center and the historic era near Ponte Vecchio.  But it is walking distance (about 1/3 of a mile or so) from the Train Station at Santa Maria Novella.  This is the only thing preventing me from giving it 5 stars.

title: Brilliant at the price
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: pleasant stay
review: A very good hotel at Florence and I must have been lucky to get the room at a very good price or they must be selling low. It's a star hotel and is very close to the station while the location of the hotel is away from the hustle and gives a good feel of the beautiful Tuscan city. The hotel is a bit far off from the historical centre but considering Florence to be a small city, you are never too far off and can be covered even by walking. However, you have the tram and bus stop right near the hotel. Reception staffs are very courteous and truly serves with a genuine smile especially the lady who took care of my check in. The room was very good, modern and the breakfast was a good elaborate spread. I will surely recommend staying in this hotel

title: Hotel with Globus Tour
review: Dear Guest,  I thank you a lot for the positive impression regarding your stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. Your comment makes us feel so proud and helps us to do all our best to continuously enhance the quality of our service. We are waiting for you in one of our Starhotels.  Best regards Gaetano Gatti General Manager

title: A pleasant stay
review: I recently had a very enjoyable 3 night stay.  The hotel has good sized, clean, quiet rooms and the excellent wifi connection made my stay easier.  Breakfast was good too.  I walked to most of the attractions from here but there was also a bus stop nearby and a tram stop almost in front, only one stop away from the central train station.

title: Fresh Property
review: Dear Guest, thank you very much for spending your time in describing the stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We’ve shared with all the staff your good impressions, which help us to do always the best in our work. We’ll expecting to see you again in Starhotels.   Best regards Gaetano Gatti General Manager

title: Nice, could be better
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Ok hotel
review: Three of us stayed in one room for one night in May, a spur of the moment visit to Florence.  We asked for three single beds, but were given a double bed and one single. To be fair, we didn't bother telling the staff about the mistake or asking them to change rooms.  The hotel looks nice and our room was modern, lovely and big. Because we were only there for one night, we didn't unpack so I can't comment on the storage space for three people.  Reception staff were very helpful with a map and information on transport and how to get to the attractions.  One member of staff gave us quite incorrect information on getting to the outlet mall though.  Our key cards didn't work when we returned to the hotel at night, so we went back down to the lobby to sort it out, and were told that…

title: Clean, modern and helpful staffs
review: Dear Guest, fiirst of all we would like to thank you for taking the time to convey your comments regarding your recent stay at Starhotels Michelangelo in Florence. Any suggestions or opinions related to our service is highly taken into consideration and, if in any way this service can be improved, be well assured that our will is to achieve this goal. Together with the entire hotel staff and management, we would like express our apologies for the inconveniences caused. We aspire to certain essential priorities, among many, such as courteous staff aimed at customer satisfaction and impeccable service. We  hope to welcome you again here another time. Sincerely. Gaetano Gatti – Manager

title: Very pleasant stay
review: Just came from a 3 night stay at the Starhotel Michealangelo in Florence.  It was an ok hotel, but nothing special.  When I originally arrived in my room I found many hairs and stains on the bed sheets.  I called the front desk and they promptly called someone to change them.  Other than that, the hotel seemed very clean.  The bathroom was newly remodeled. Beds are hard, but that is quite common in Europe.  Hotel is easy to reach from the SMN rail station - it is just 1 stop (5 min) on the tram.  It is about a 15-20 min walk to the heart of the tourist district, but I enjoy walking so it wasn't a big deal for me.  The area felt very safe.

title: Good, friendly hotel
review: Dear Guest, thank you very much for spending your time in describing the stay in our Starhotels Michelangelo. We’ve shared with all the staff your good impressions and your experience with us, which help us to do always the best in our work. We’ll expecting to see you again. Best regards. Gaetano Gatti – Manager

review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good Hotel
review: We recently held a conference in Florence, and the hotel has good conference facilities, eager staff, but of course not five star quality. Brilliant rooms and cleaning services, but no iron. Great experience all in all, would visit again!!

title: Very nice and luxurious
review: Clean, spacious and modern. Luxurious rooms, bathrooms, lobby. Breakfast was nice- continental  (scrambled eggs/bacon available  for those who enjoy a cholesterol rich start to their day) Good location near to the tram and bus stops, offers a nice walk into the centre along the river. Receptionists were helpful. Overall really enjoyed it, my number one choice every time I'm in Florence given the cost-benefit analysis.

title: Funky hotel
review: Luxurious hotel, helpful staff, very clean rooms but too expensive (16 euros for a hamburger + 5 euros for the "room service fee" and 4 euros for 330ml of water from the mini-bar) and with many facilities charged as extra (e.g. WiFi).

title: A Mixture of Experiences...
review: The hotel is really vibrant and fun. Good service, yummy breakfast, functional gym facilities. The wifi system was really annoying and we thought given what we paid to stay there the hotel would be good enough to offer free wifi to guests in their room, rather then in the lobby that times you out every 30 minutes. The hotel was a fair distance from the main center of Florence and dining options etc are fewer, however there were great sights to see on the walk into town

title: Florence average hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Excellent Stay, Great Location with Friendly Staff
review: Modern decor. On a side street not close to the sights. breakfast was good, not much fresh fruit. The bar in the evening was very nice with good service. Front desk service was inconsistant, sometimes excellent and sometimes poor. Rooms were small beds were not that comfortable. Internet worked well. just okay for the money

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: We had a great stay at Michelangelo Hotel in Florence, Italy.  When we arrived by train, we hopped onto the tram and got off at the first stop.  The hotel was just steps away from the tram stop which made it very convenient, when carrying luggage from the train station.  When we arrived we were greeted by very friendly hotel staff, who showed us a map of Florence and places to go.  The lobby was very modern, with comfortable couches, fireplace and bar.  Our room was exceptionally clean and modern, with a larger then normal size bathroom for European standards.   Breakfast is served in the lower level in a large dining area.  They had a variety of pastries, eggs, bacon, fruit, juices, coffee, cereal , and yogurt to choose from which is included in the cost of your room.   My…

title: Nice and Clean
review: This is a very modern, sleek hotel.  Beautiful lobby with a fireplace, bar, and free massage chair.  We had a triple room with two single beds and an alcove with a separate bed, chair,TV, and private terrace.  Breakfast had a large variety.  Two minor complaints were regarding the room.  The bathroom door was a frosted glass which means that if you're in there at night, the light will shine in the room.  Also, everything echoes due to the minimalist design and wood flooring.  My mom dropped a necklace on the floor and it jolted me out of my sleep.  Otherwise, great location near the Arno River.  Highly recommended.

title: Can't use phone and Ethernet at the same time
review: They have remodeled most of the rooms. We had a room on the first floor that has not been updated yet, but it was nice and spacious! When we arrived our room was not clean and the offered us an upgraded room. They came to clean right away and everything was great! Mistakes happen especially at a busy time of year! However they did a good job of resolving the issue quickly!

title: Excellent
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Very nice hotel near the tram
review: Great location. Within walking distance from attractions. Rooms were clean and spacious.  Service was great.  Breakfast was fantastic.  Wifi was free. The lounge was very inviting and drinks were reasonable.

title: Great Hotel in Florence. A Bit Of A Walk
review: Very nice hotel right across the street from the tram for easy access to other areas of town.  The staff was pleasant, the bed comfortable.  The room was nicely decorated. The bathroom was a typical European bathroom, a little small by American standards, but very clean and worked fine for us.  The breakfast has a good variety of meats, cheeses, eggs, pastries, fruit, juices, coffee and tea.  Our room on the first floor even had a nice, private patio.  We were on a tour, so I don't know the prices at this hotel. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Not all that it is hyped up to be....
review: The hotel was nice and comfortable.  It was a bit of a walk to all of the restaurants and nightlife in Florence.  The staff was very helpful and guided us to the places that we needed to go.  They even helped us find the rental car agency that we were looking for.

title: Good modern hotel
review: There is no doorman...so if you drive over from France..as we did...run in and let them tell you how to get to car park that costs 23€ a day. Fine ...this trip was a 2 night gift and we were just happy to be in Florence.The hotel is well placed, not slap bang in the action but a stones throw from the river Arno and in the "consulate"area of Florence. The room was perfect,lovely modern decor and very roomy and clean.Ok... the window overlooked the entrance to the car park and the back of some building but who cares! We were here for the Uffizi and the David...need I say more. Well I should about this 4 star hotel: the shower is a trickle of water and whenthe weather  was as hot as it was...a trickle is very disappointing. Let us move on to the towel...it was threadbare and had…

title: Great service, excellent rooms
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Very good deal
review: This is my first TripAdvisor review, and I just had to write one for this hotel. My two friends and I stayed here for 2 nights and had the most amazing experience. The room was impeccable and comfortably fitted the 3 of us (3 single beds). The bathroom was nice and modern, and we got free internet in our rooms simply by checking in on Foursquare. The free breakfast was very nice (eggs, oatmeal, delicious nutella croissants, etc.), but what topped it all off was when I called to get a wake up call at 4am for my flight, the front desk took the initiative to ask if I wanted a to-go breakfast. I didn't even know that was possible, and I just really appreciate it when staff really think about your needs - Sure enough I got a to-go bag of fruit, yogurt, and crackers that helped make…

title: nice hotel, nice location but beware
review: The hotel is very good, well designed and with a good breakfast. The room was what we need with a great bathroom. Te location is also nice, not in the center (but public transportation works well in Firenze) but close to everywhere. We really appreciate staying 3 nights there and enjoyinig the many attractions of Firenze.

title: Welcome rest and relief
review: They say they offer free internet but it is only in the lobby. They say they offer cribs, but only in certain rooms. My daughter had to sleep between us on the double bed, they could provide us a crib on the second day.  They say there is no need to reserve a parking place but the hotel has only 10 parking lots, so we couldn't get one. They work with an external garage where they can keep the  cars with the same rate (23 euro per night) but they charged us extra to bring cars back and forth.

title: Nice hotel but far from tourist attractions
review: Slightly on the edge of the central action - and thank goodness for that - Florence in July/August really is wall-to-wall tourists (armies of large tour groups being your biggest inconvenience) so after a full day of exploring the unmissable historical centre and all its attractions whilst enduring the queues all in very hot conditions, your reward comes even as you make your way back to the hotel with quieter, wider streets. The hotel was modern and our room (a quadruple) was very well laid out. The air conditioning was so effiecent and the beds so clean and comfortable. Robes and slippers and a spotless bathroom just added to the luxurious, efficient feel. We loved breakfast. Bacon and eggs being the hot staple but there's an enormous range of meats, cheese, cake, fruit,…

title: Loved it
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Excellent hotel! Highly recommend!
review: We got upgraded on arrival so our review may be a bit biased.  Room was clean, modern and had a comfortable bed. All staff were friendly even though at times they were clearly stressed. Wifi is free in lobby but not always working. Massage chair is free and highly recommended just don't overdo it! Location is about 15 min walk to the city  centre and 10 min walk  to the train station. We got tram to and from station due to luggage which is 1.40 euros. It's only one stop and hotel is just across road. Breakfast is good. Bacon, scrammbled eggs, fruit, pastries, yoghurt, juices,  cereals.  Would definitely stay again.

title: All it lacked was strong Internet
review: We arrived at Starhotels for a 4 night after a 5 night stay in venice. As we walked in it was clear the hotel was immaculate. The decor was fantastic and the lady at the front desk was more than helpful and very welcoming and polite. We had a double standard room, it was perfect. Spacious, clean, air con and again decor was second to none. Fresh towels and toiletries everyday. The location was good also but only good if you are willing to walk 15/20 minutes in to the main part of Florence and we were more than happy to. It's just a beautfiul walk down the River Amo and then when you get to the famous Ponte Vecchio bridge you turn in to the centre of Florence where you can see all the best attractions. The hotel was great value only down side being that you only had free wifi…

title: More than you expect!
review: Here's what was very good: -  The rooms and bathrooms are newly renovated with a fresh modern feel and lovely hansgrohe fixtures -  The rooms are very quiet, with double-paned heavy windows blocking out the traffic below -  The bed and linens are very comfortable and high quality -  The people who work there are focused on your happiness, and are very service oriented -  The bar American is a great place to relax after a long day of sightseeing  What you might be disappointed in: - Wireless Internet access is quite poor.  If you are hosting a business event and need a lot of broadband, go wired or reconsider -  The food in the restaurant is so-so.  With so many great places right outside the door, it should not deter you from this hotel

title: Family friendly hotel as well as business hotel!
review: Stayed here for one night when visiting Florence. It looks a bit old from the outside but it's nicely decorated and the rooms have everything you need. My room even had TV in the bathroom and a selection of 4 different firmness pillows to choose from. The buffet breakfast is very fresh and complete. Wifi is free in the common areas (reception/bar).

title: It's the best you can get from a 4 stars hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: A short break
review: We just checked out from a 3 nights stay in this hotel in Florence. This hotel is definitely different from any other hotels you can get in Florence. The building itself looks very different from all the ancient buildings around, but it's not too modern that look awkward. I like how it looks very much. The whole hotel looks very hip.    We arrived the hotel at 11:30am, the room was ready for us already. The reception staffs were very friendly and professional. Apart from just checking us in, they offered a brief introduction of the city to us, which is very impressive.   The room is quite small actually. There is only one corner in the room that I can open my suitcase completely. But the room is very new, clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom is very spacious and beautiful.…

title: If only the bed had been just a little softer
review: We stayed only for one evening so i didn't have time to check out all aspects. it has a charming  modern  design of common areas and well appointed spacey rooms. Convenient location to enter/leave the city from the north when traveling  with a car. Nice breakfast. A bit pricey though

title: Great stay in Executive room
review: If only the bed had been slightly softer than a slab of granite this hotel would have been wonderful. The staff are among the most helpful anywhere and the rooms extremely good value at the rate which we obtained (Eur93)

title: Good Hotel! Good Location. Great Breakfast Buffet
review: We booked online and turned out to be a great stay. 'Executive' room (in the 2nd floor, I believe it was room 212) was very comfortable. Excellent sommier and pillows. Everything was very clean. The staff at the reception, was very helpful. Also breakfast, is very complete: including hams and cheeses, eggs in different styles and bacon, fruits, yogurts, juices, breads, etc. Coffee is prepared by the personnel according to your order. To  be improved: Wi-fi connection is free only in the lobby (... you need to renew  your password, every 30 minutes). Anyhow, the lobby has very comfortable sofas, with plenty of seating, and books or magazines to read. A must: the chair massager, which is a great relaxation after a strenuous day, walking around Florence. Not so good: this hotel is…

title: Recent stay- May 2013- Great location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Enjoyable
review: Great location- Walking distance to the center of Florence for shopping and restaurants. This was the best hotel we stayed at in a 10 day Globus tour we were just on, so not sure what we paid as far as value, but it was the nicest we stayed at compared to Rome, Venice and Milan. Rooms are new, clean and up to date. The lobby was clean and roomy. Nice bar with enough area for people to relax. Very friendly staff. Nice people they make you feel appreciated. Wonderful place would recommend to anyone to stay.  Only negative was bathroom is a bit tight. The door going into the bathroom comes inches away from the sink.

title: Excellent, but expensive
review: Our room was nicely redone and clean and comfortable.  In addition, one evening we dined there was we were too tired to travel out.  We had a great meal and excellent service in the small dining area adjacent to the bar.  At first glance it was so small we doubted the meal would be much more than average but we were wrong.l  The bartender did an excellent job of serving us and the food was quite good.  A nice surprise after a very busy day touring the art and history of Florence!  Definitely recommend it.

title: Hit or miss half-renovated hotel
review: We enjoined our stay at Starhotel Michelangelo. In walking distance from city center (20 minutes). The hotel was perfect (rooms, breakfast, service, cleanliness etc), but the price for a room (EUR 200 per night incl. breakfast) too expensive.

title: Clean, nice rooms
review: I care about nothing but a clean, safe room to sleep in when travelling. Walking into this hotel, I thought I had hit the jackpot, really nice entrance that looks recently renovated. At check in, I got the basic service, card to the room and information on where the breakfast would be served. No map of the city offered (though they do have one available, so feel free to ask). Also, WiFi is free in the lobby, they won't tell you this either (you have to get a username and password from them, valid for 30 min - but you can get more than one paper with this info at a time). Then the real fun begins, you can either be assigned a newly renovated room or an old one. In my case, I got an old one and even though I had requested a non-smoking room, I got a smoking room. No matter what…

title: Super
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Excellent Value - Exceeded Expectations
review: Lovely hotel close to the centre of Florence.  Very clean with all modern conveniences.  Staff very helpful free wifi. Close to tram and buses, lots of great restaurants close by. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Modern & Clean Hotel; Great Location!
review: We got an excellent rate (84 euros per night) for a long weekend we recently spent in Florence.  The hotel really was fantastic.  We took the train from Rome to Florence and after we figured out where to ride the tram (go out the station to the right as you leave the train platforms and down the stairs), all was good.  It is the first stop on the tram from the train station, about 2 minutes ride.  Purchase the ticket in front of the tram stop from the electronic kiosk, 1.20 euros and validate in the yellow box on the tram.  The hotel was right behind the 1st tram stop and easy access.  The lobby is large and very friendly and helpful staff.  They gave us a great suggestion for a very popular pizzaria nearby as well as other transportation options around the city.  The rooms were…

title: Average
review: Among the 3 hotels we stayed throughout this trip, this is my favorite. The hotel is very modern and clean. The location is great, conveniently located in the central area. Our room is on the top floor so I had somewhat great view from our bedroom window. Love it!

title: Elegant hotel with good location
review: Stayed for 3 nights last week. We thought the room was right above a loading bay as we heard loud noise from machines/lifts every morning. Hotel reception told us the noise might come from street level. Anyway, the rooms are not sound proof. We can hear clearly when the room next to us flushed the toilet.  Hotel is 10-15 mins walking to the center. A taxi to train station cost Euro 8. Average hotel.

title: Lovely modern hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: No a/c in rooms;too far away
review: Nice modern rooms... Very clean... It's a bit further from town, so if you are looking for a hotel in the heart of the city then this hotel is not right for you. However there is bus stop right outside & it takes 5 mins by bus to be in the city centre. In fact it's nice to be a bit away from city noise. We really enjoyed our stay for 4nites. Breakfast is nice. I wouldn't say superb... I definitely recommend this hotel...

title: Clean neat place
review: I stayed for four days at the Michelangelo and I won't go back. They don't provide air-conditioning in the rooms at this time of year, I assume to save money. What that meant for me was i could either sleep in a hot stuffy room or open the window to the VERY cold air and listen to the noise from the very busy road outside. Even a cheap motel in the U.S. provides year-round a/c ! Breakfast was served on the lower level in a windowless room whose decor was as bland as the limited buffet food. Don't look for oatmeal, omelets, fried or poached eggs, pancakes, waffles or anything special. The hotel is too far away from the City Center which means when you leave in the morning you're gone for the entire day and can't run back to your hotel to use the bathroom, change clothes, drop off…

title: A Lucky Find
review: Nice rooms... Great service... Not so great location but... Overall nice place... Very starish... Big rooms quite unlike other European hotels... Very friendly staff... Ensure that u hv a grappa at the bar

title: Good quality hotel
review: Upon arriving at the Hotel after a long day of traveling and touring, we were greeted by a friendly and caring front desk clerk.  Throughout our stay, the front desk was extremely helpful, especially when they had to arrange for 2 cabs to rescue us on the highway somewhere between Florence and Sienna on Christmas Day.  The rooms and baths were new and clean.  The breakfasts were wonderful.  The location was an easy walk from all of the Florence attractions.  I would stay there again and am sorry that we didn't book its sister hotel in Rome.

title: Contemporary Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Great renewed rooms
review: The room we had in this hotel was "picture worthy" though my daughter has the pictures.   Beautiful room with hardwood floors, flat screen tv, bathroom with bidet, coffee pot in room, hair dyer.  Everything very clean and modern.  Breakfast buffet was very good and we had dinner at hotel and was also very good.  Would return and would try other Star hotels.

title: Don't stay in a handicap room if you don't need it!!!!!
review: Had the perfect experience in Florence. The hotel lobby is very beautiful and the renewed rooms are great. If you are riding by car there is a public parking lot right in front at the hotel and on the weekends it's free.   The room was very clean and really nice. The breakfast was ok, not the best I ever had, but it was ok. Would certainly stay again in this hotel.

title: Value for the money
review: This is a nice contemporary hotel, but we were booked into a handicap room when we didn't need one.   The problem is that the shower has no curtain or shower wall.  You have a shower head on the bathroom wall and if you take a shower the total floor of the bathroom will be very wet.  They were at capacity at check-in so we couldn't be switched to non-handicap room. To accomodate us, they brought up 4-5 extra towels that we could wipe the floor down after a shower.   This would be a 5 star hotel if it wasn't for our handicap room experience.

title: Great Rooms - Inside Gems
review: I have stayed in this hotel on 14th of October with my other 2 friends / 3 rooms. Generally good and spacious room, please note we are in the suite. Bar- special thanks to the bar attendant, (forgot the name) who made us feeling so comfortable with his smiley face and energetic service Restaurant- there was nobody in the dining hall except us, but the same bar attendant make our dinner so lively and he is very active. Opening the room little different than other hotels. the card reader is in the wall left side to the door, and once yuou insert the card, you hear a sound of 'kkrkrkrk' and you need top push the door inside by hand to open, I was inserting the card waiting for the sound and turn the knob, nothing happen, at last asked for hotel assistence.  Breakfast buffet was…

title: Great Hotel - Location Better than First Impression
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: What a dump!
review: When we first rode the train to the hotel, we were concerned about location.  The area itself seemed a bit sketchy at first but it ended up being a great location near the river and Central Park just across the street.  For those of you who are runners like we are, this is a perfect place to get in daily runs with the locals while escaping the overly crowded city.  The room itself was a nice size by European standards and it was nice that they provided a electric kettle for coffee and teas.  The hotel had a nice bar in the lobby area which was a nice place to hang out after a long day and to enjoy a beer or cocktail.  Breakfast was included which was a nice amenity to have and convenient.

title: Quite nice hotel in convinient place
review: This is the typical hotel that posts amazing pictures and when you get there, from looking at the building, you start praying.... The lobby is great, they do provide free wi-fi in "executive" rooms and the breakfast is very decent, front office staff are great, available umbrellas for rainy days..... Now, once you get out of the elevator, to go to your room, you start to fear the inevitable... A nasty looking room.  The carpet that used to be bright green is brown.  How do I know that it was green? Well the carpet that decorates the wall seems to be of the sme color. We did not take our shoes off.  The bathroom smelled old.  No electric plugs to charge all the electronics that are now used in this modern times.  My son woke up in the morning with bed bug bites (about 3), big…

title: Excellent - the best place to stay in Florence
review: Dear Guest,  we would like to thank you for taking the time to leave your opinion about your stay in our hotel and we are really sorry to understand that your experience with us was not so good as you expected. Any suggestion or opinions related to our service is highly appreciated and taken into consideration in order to improve our quality of hospitality.  We like to inform you that most rooms of the Starhotels Michelangelo (around 70%) and common areas like lobby, bar, restaurant,  etc. had been recently renovated,  2010/2011. The posted pictures in Trip Advisor, Expedia, Booking.com, etc, as you can see present the renovated rooms and  old rooms too. Executive rooms are big enough to accommodate with comfort familes, for a maximum occupancy of 4, but are located in the non-renovated areas (1st and second floor), even if they will be object of a complete refurbishment (new materials, parquet on the carpet, new bathroom) early 2013. Our hotel chain invests for refurbishment a large amount of money every year to update the product.  About the bed bug you wrote in  your comment, we want you the be sure that we never had  such a problem in our property as you can easily see from the many reviews present in Trip Advisor, Expedia, etc., and we completely checked all the rooms of the 1st and 2nd floor after we received your comment and fortunately  we didn't find any bed bug.   We apologize once again for your unpleasant experience, we trust in the positive comments we receive by our guests, even on this website, hoping you might reconsider your opinion to our Hotel and let us welcoming you again in one of our Starhotels.  Best regards,  Gaetano Gatti - General Manager

title: Very nice hotel and central!
review: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and satisfied with my stay. It is in 1 min walk from tram station. Tram comes directly from train station and only 1 stop and you are here. Tram works every 5 minutes. It costs 1.2 eur per person.  To walk to the city centre is easy, but it will take from 20-30 minutes. Especially in hot days not quite pleasant walk because there is no any shadow area in your way along riverside. And even nowhere to sit  Hotel description says free internet (WiFi) in hotel lobby, actually this is not true, the device shows the availability of internet and that is all. It doesn't work at all. I asked staff and the only reply which i got is that pay 10 eur per day and internet in the room will be better. Actually nobody was in hall so they can't say that too…

title: Good Modern Hotel 15 Minutes Walk from the City Centre
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Sufficient for business...
review: Stayed here for two nights in July. Good location. On site secure parking at an extra charge. The lobby is very nice with free wifi. Service was good. Rooms were nice, clean and modern however slightly cramped. The hotel was fair for the price. I would stay again.

title: Nice, Contemporary Hotel, Good location
review: I would recommend this hotel for business people only given the good corporate rate I got.  It's a bit of a trek from the city centre & central train station if you're rushed; the interior is clean & functional.  I stayed for several nights & ate dinner one night only - limited choice & expensive.  The rooms were OK but a bit dated.  Big downside is there's nowhere to sit outside with a drink in the evening! Staff were not very helpful when I had a travel query & generally seemed more concerned with their own discussions than the queue of waiting customers.

title: Spacious room
review: Good location, close to Train station. Hotel rooms were nice, clean and had very modern finishes. Friendly Hotel staff and breakfast was great! Would recommend this hotel.

title: Not our favorite
review: It's a pain driving around Florence, but we managed to get to the hotel by just asking people which way to the Ponte Vecchio. Once I arrived at the river I just followed it until we located our hotel. We arrived and they upgraded me to a room with a balcony. Be aware that parking is expensive no matter where you park. For convenience park inside the hotels parking lot. Our room was nice and spacious, but the balcony was dirty with bird droppings so we did not use it. Spend at least two nights in Florence as there is too much to see and the queues can take up some of your time. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was good and offered a good variety of breads, cereals and coffee. The hotel is a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio, which is fine  because there are restaurants,…

title: Very comfortable beds, low water pressure in shower
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Business as Usual
review: I'm used to hard beds so the one at this hotel was wonderful.  The shower leaves a bit to be desired... Low water pressure which takes a bit of getting used to. Other than that, staff are friendly although free Internet is only available in public areas. There are newly refurbished rooms on the upper floors, so try to ask for this when making your booking.

title: Michelangelo
review: I joined my husband on a business trip to Florence.  The Michelangelo is clean, efficient, modern and perfect for business meetings for groups (it has a conference room and food service for meetings). If you are a tourist, however, know that it is situated in a nondescript area, a little far from the sights of Florence, at least a 20-30 minute walk from the center of the city.  The walk is pleasant enough, but it is definitely out of the way.

title: Good hotel. Good location
review: Many Thanks to everybody who are working in this hotel.  With  big pleasure  I will stay here again in my next trip . It is a really nice hotel! Large, comfortable rooms.  Nook, pleasant and beautiful lobby bar.

title: Great hotel, highly recommended
review: Stayed in the hotel at the end of Jan 2012. Large and clean modern interior. Beds are rock hard, so I had a hard time sleeping most nights. Breakfast every morning, selection of breads, fruit,  cereal etc. The "american" breakfast is scrambled eggs and bacon, ham and swiss cheese... Would be better if they put out some of the wonderful italian meats and cheeses, but it is good and makes a good start to the day.  The restaurant is upscale, so not alot of simple italian dishes but its good. Some of the service staff is great, a few are not and come off as very snotty. They do have roomservice.  Ponte Vechio is about a nice  20 min walk down the river, which leads to many shopping and museums. Also makes a great meeting place for people who arn't sure how to get around the city to…

title: wonderful convenient to many places..
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good stay in Florence!
review: I love going to international Flea Markets on my vacations---staying at this hotel is right across the street from a lovely park which houses the Mercado Delle Cascine Flea Market on Tuesday mornings...a great Flea Market....The hotel is close to buses, about a 10 minute walk to the center of town. You won't find many restaurants near to the hotel, but the staff is very courteous, the room was clean and spacious and the breakfast certainly adequate. /we were able to obtain bus tickets, good suggestions about the neighborhood and they even had free umbrellas when it rained.

title: nice, but could be a bit better
review: We booked this hotel last mins and surprisingly it become one of the best hotel that we stayed during our trip in Italy. Good value of money, great location ( 1 tram stop to station or 15 mins walk for station is walking distance to the center of Florence )  We managed to check in earlier. Room was not so big, but it was well-decorated and comfort. Bathroom with bathtub is decent and clean.  Staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would like come back definitely !

title: Nice place to stay
review: I got a great rate on expedia for this hotel for one night, but stayed the next 4 nights for a conference.  The hotel staff was top-notch during the days, but a little lack luster in the early morning or overnight hours.  I was impressed with the room size and accommodations. The bathrooms were small, but it did not create any problems.  The only complaint for the rooms, is that the doors are not at all soundproof.   You can hear EVERYTHING in the hallways.    The bar staff were very helpful and stayed HOURS past closing to serve the conference guests.  The breakfast was ok, not great.  The free internet in the lobby was embarassing.  Slow and unreliable.  They should either make it free all over the hotel (the room internet for $ was very fast and reliable) or just get rid of…

title: Stylish Hotel
review: Dear Guest, we would like to thank you for taking your precious time to say a few word about your stay at our Starhotels Michelangelo. Any suggestions or opinions related to our service is highly apprecieted and if in any way this service can be improved, be well  assured that our will is to achieve this goal.  My staff and I would like to express our apologies for the inconveniences you had about the slow internet connection in the lobbly. Probably  many guests used the internet connection at same time. We have requested our supplier to verify   and possibly  improve the service. Once again we apologize for the  troubles caused and hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you again in our Starhotels Michelangelo. General Manager

title: Comfortable hotel catering to foreign tour groups.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: A very comfortable hotel if  bit away from the centre
review: Large, comfortable rooms and baths. English speaking staff is quite helpful at making suggestions and reservations for sightseeing and dining. Location is away from the core of old Firenze and also quieter. City bus stops are nearby. Great lobby and bar area for lounging. The complimentary breakfast was very good-obviously targeted more to American tastes. One negative was the wi-fi, complimentary only in the lobby for 30 minutes at a time.

title: Good hotel, be prepared for a stroll
review: Like most reviewers, we found this hotel to be more than satisfactory.  We came here with a Globus tour and were pleasantly surprised at the facilities.  The room was well equipped - very spacious bathroom - although the view was of the back of the hotel.. Breakfast was excellent but best of all was the bar - soft drinks with lots of ice!! Snacks were served with drinks and the service was great.  Public Internet access was readily available. There was a very good family style restaurant - Vecchio Carlino -  about a block away; the food was so tasty that we ate there twice and took friends.

title: Business hotel near the river
review: Great hotel - service was really good, the man at the front desk spent a frustrating time reserving us tickets for the the Uffizi but he persevered and was very helpful. Rooms are spacious, clean and well-appointed. Breakfast was,one of the best that we had throughout our Italy stay.  One, I think,, minor downside is the location - it's a twenty minute walk to, say, the Ponte Vecchio - but this is a very pleasant walk along the river and well worth it for a such a decent hotel at such a decent price - plus there's always the tram right outside that will take you up to the station when you're legs are tired!

title: Very Satisfactory
review: It was nice but a little old in the rooms. More expensive than the sister hotel in Bologna which is better by far.

title: Chain hotel yes, but a very worthy option
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. title: Great hotel and staff
review: Chain hotels often get overlooked on this site I find. Granted, they mostly all look one and the same, with very little difference in features and service, from one city to the next, all very uniform. However, when you're looking at a tourist city like Florence, complete with tourist prices, these places can be a godsend, and this hotel was better than average...  Stayed here for three nights in July 2011 with the other half. A pretty good location, just over 10 mins walk from the main train station and airport bus stop, and about 20 mins from all of the attractions. The neighbourhood is nothing to get excited about, but safe enough, and only a few minutes away from the river Arno, making it a pleasant walk in.  As for the hotel itself, I'd say its a lot more stylish than most…

title: Excellent choice in terms of position, price and services
review: Room was great -- modern, spacious, a/c worked great.  Catch the tram right outside train station, first stop right at hotel. Breakfast was great and included.  Staff was so nice.  We left something  in the room and they mailed it to us in the states free of charge.  Definitely a great choice especially if you need to be close to train station.

title: Comfortable and pleasant
review: In one expensive city such as Florence where simply B&B in the wide center range costs a lot, it's really surprising find modern, ellegant hotel with good services and almost in the core city centre at reasonable price. For this advantage, this is more than excellent choice for everybody who prefers good quality/money ratio.  The position is good - its not in the core city centre (centro storico) but its reachable by walk in 15-20 min all city attractions such are Ponte Vecchio, Duomo, Uffizi ecc. It's recently renewed furnished well in modern, ellegant, japanese/european style, simply but trendy and ellegant. Rooms are spacious (which is surprising especiallly for standard/normal room) and furnished with the style. Bathrooms are great, modern. High sleeping quality with the…

title: Great hotel, but a bit far away
review: Firstly I did not think this was that far out the way, it is 10 mins walk to Santa Croce square and 12-15 to the Duomo, it was nice to vary the routes to and from the hotel and visit the less touristy but equally nice side streets that Florence has on offer.  It is also right next to a rather large and nice park and an even better walk is to leave the hotel walk down to the Arno river and walk in to the center via the Arno. All in all, it is only a long way if you have mobility issues.  There were elements to this Hotel that were 4 star as I know it and elements which I thought were 3 star. Considering the distance, the quality of other Florence   Worthy of 4 Stars:  Friendly Bar staff and the best bar snacks in any bar I have been to, which are put out in the evening.  Friendly…

title: Nice, modern hotel; location a little out of the way
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: What I expected excellent service
review: I stayed at the Michelangelo for two nights as part of a tour group.  The hotel was modern, clean and the rooms were quite large.  The staff were exceptionally helpful with questions and directions.  I had some trouble using my room key and the front desk staff came with me to show me how to use it, which was very much appreciated after a long day of travel.  The staff also provided a map of the area and gave directions and information for restaurants and a laundromat.  I did not eat in the hotel restaruant, but had some drinks at the bar and they were very reasonable, and the bar had munchies, too!  There is a fabulous restaruant called The Steak House which is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel.  Highly recommended.  There is also a pizza shop (along the way to the steak…

title: Try another hotel
review: Really convenient first stop on new tram from central train station bus runs from outside to all tourist sites. Very clean if a bit dated

title: Excellent accomodations with friendly, personable staff.
review: We stayed here for one night and while we received help on check in and they even "upgraded" us to an executive suite, I would advise you to avoid this hotel at all costs.  The upgraded room was bigger than the others however it was not updated like the pictures on the website would have you believe the room looks.  Additionally it smelled like smoke, probably from before you were banned from smoking in the room.  The main problem we had occured the day we were checking out, we had arranged at check-in to have a  car pick us up and do a winery tour the next day, and the staff said we had to pay them $200 Euro in cash before the car picked us up at 2pm...I went to the ATM and my bank (US Bank) had put a freeze on my account and I had to call them to unlock it.  When I went to the…

title: choose another hotel
review: Well situated hotel with comfortable rooms and an attractive lobby.  The food in the restaurant is delicious, and the bar area is attractive and comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: faster than light customer service
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice hotel, but a bit deceiving
review: i come to florence from NY every year to attend the food trade show Taste and always stay at the Michelangelo which is across the street from Stazione Leopolda, where Taste takes place. in terms of convenience, nothing can beat  this hotel. i checked in today. as i walked in, i noticed a big improvement in the decor of the hotel. it has been completely renovated, the lobby has beautiful metal screens made by an artist and they resemble all old florentine patterns. when i returned to the room, after a very long and tiring day, i realized i didn't have any toothpaste and asked the reception desk. do they have any? i had not hung up and somebody rang the door with the tooth paste. i was amazed. and very grateful. thank you!!!

title: Too far away from anything..
review: From the outside and the lobby, Hotel Michelangelo looks like a very nice place.  But go a little deeper and you'll see a few haphazard repairs and crappy cover-ups of an older more aged building.  The staff is friendly and basically helpful.  Our room was large and had a fairly large bathroom.  But if you're planning on capatalizing on the breakfast included with your stay, don't.  The staff in the breakfast restaurant is rude and careless.  The food was absolutely terrible, right down to the coffee.  They served the usual croissants and breads, but the other eggs and meats they offered were truly wrong.  The lobby and hotel bar area have a trendy feel to them and the location suited us just fine.  The hotel is located a bit off of the main parts of Florence, but no more than a…

title: Good for business travellers -not for families
review: Michelango Hotel Florence  My room stunk of smoke even though it was supposedly a non-smoking room.  It was quite overwhelming and was so bad, it made my eyes sting on the first night.  I aired out the room so it improved for the second night.  The hotel was located on the outskirts of the city so it was a fair walk to the main shopping area.  The service was very good and the staff were helpful.

title: The hotel needs renovation and is not a modern hotel.
review: It is a good hotel, but lacks character. Good for the usual business traveller but not for family atmosphere. There are other better options in Firenze.   Breakfast is poor. There is a waiter hanging around you all the while you are eating. He keeps a close eye on your table and is very keen to take away the plate even if it means that you are not done with it. The bread is served but not the types you get in supermarkets in U.K. Meaning you cannot apply butter or toast them. They are round, porous and hard.   Location is ok, not in the heart of the city but is navigable. Air - conditioning was not very good.  Overall OK, but unfortunately lacks the ambience for a family outing.

title: Nice hotel... need a car to move around...
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Do not stay here............
review: The hotel was very nice... staff very good... and the food was delicious... the hotel is very far from main attractions so if you stayed here rent a car or move by taxi...

title: nice
review: Needs improvement  The weather was somewhat warm. There was no airconditioning working in our room so we left the sliding door open, it didn't lock anyway. There are also huge garbage recepticals across the street from the hotel and every morning they would crush the trash in front of our room for hours. Smashing bottles and glass constantly.  The maid did not clean the toilet.  The ceiling had mold and water damage.  The bed was as hard as a piece of plywood.

title: Nice hotel close to the center
review: we were upgraded to executive suites and were very happy with our hotel.  The staff was excellent and very helpful. We took the bus into the city and it was very easy but coming back was a nightmare. The bus drivers were ignorant and not very helpful we waited an hour until we could finally get some locals to help us. We had an excellent meal beside Il Duomo.

title: Great Hotel! Close to the mains atractions, clean and comfortable!
review: One more nice stay at this hotel during august 2009 helpfull staff nice clean rooms free parking and close to the river only 2 blocks away.and 1500m from Ponte Vechio.

title: Modern and Clean
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Cosy
review: We stayed here as part of a Globus tour. Our room was charming, clean and neat. Our breakfast buffet was included and there were lots of choices. The concierge staff was friendly and there was a funky spot across the street for a pleasant dinner. There was some construction going on in the street but we were not bothered by it. Others have mentioned that it is a bit of a walk to the historical area but it is doable. If you have been on your feet all day, you might find it a bit too far but it is easy to find the hotel if you keep the river on your left when heading back to the hotel.

title: Value for money
review: We stayed 2 nites in this hotel. Location is a quite a way out from the heart of Florence but can still be done easily by walking 20/25 mn. Staff is professional. We had an executive room for a family of 4. It was quite spacious and cosy. The bed for the adults was large with good quality and recent/comfortables edeirdown & pillows. Bathrobes and slippers were provided for all the guests. The WiFi was available but with extra charge. The breakfast was a buffet. Not terrific but good enough. In summary a charming and cosy hotel. I was actually quite surprised (nicely surprised) by its quality. As it belongs to an hotel's chain (StarHotels), I will most definitely include them in my short list for my next trips to Italia

title: Nice but smelled like cigarettes
review: Stayed one night in April 2009. Spacious room. Very clean.The bathroom was clean and large. The hotel restaurant was good. A little out of the way from the core. Disable people might find it difficult to negotiate the steps down to the front desk from the street. The desk staff was very courteous and helpful.

title: out of the way but nice
review: Stayed at this hotel in early April. We were upgraded to the executive room as they saw we were in the system from staying at the other starhotels while in Italy. The room was nice. The bad thing was that the air didnt work. Realized that the air didnt work at any of the starhotels we stayed in. We couldnt open the windows at this hotel because there was a lot of street noise. The hotel also smelled like cigarette smoke no matter where we were. The hotel is very close to the train station. Also, it appears that there will be train lines running next to the hotel in the near future so it might be very noisy at some point. The hotel is okay for the price.

title: I (hearted) Starhotels
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Friendly staff, good price
review: My boyfriend and I visited Italy in the Summer of '06, and while in Florence we stayed at the Starhotels Michelangelo, and it was fantastic.  Granted, the hotels in Venice and Rome we stayed in were cheaper and a lower class, but this is still the nicest hotel I have stayed in in Europe for under $100 a night.   I am a hotwire.com supersleuth, and always manage to figure out the actual identity of the hotel.  Expedia is its partner site, and you can usually compare the star ratings and amenities to narrow it down, and if they give you the original price on hotwire you can be 99% sure of the hotel.  So, we managed to book this hotel for $99 a night, which added to its charm.   While it was a bit difficult to find and a decent walk from the center, the interior more than made up…

title: Good Experience
review: We stayed two nights in Florence, in the Starhotel Michelangelo. The hotel building doesn't look very promising on the outside, but the inside is recently renovated and has all you would expect from a four star hotel. The personnel at the reception desk is very friendly and allways prepared to help. The rooms are very comfortable and clean, small minus is you have to pay for wireless internet access.  Distance to the city center is approx. 1.5 km, but this is more then compensated by the relatively cheap price you pay for a four star room and there are also busses to the center every seven minutes (bus stop in front of the hotel). Would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone who's looking for a comfortable place to sleep in Florence at a fair price.

title: Fantastic Rome
review: We booked an executive room in the hotel, which was really lovely, it had it's own sitting room which made our stay even nicer, particularly after a busy days site seeing.  Florance is wonderful and well worth a visit.  I would stay in the hotel again, however, the breakfast was poor and tasteless and what is it with Italian hotels they don't know how to serve a hot cup of tea!  I would recommend this hotel, but go out for breakfast.

title: Very nice place to stay
review: StarHotel Michelangelo is really close to St Peters (5 Minute walk) and you could see it from our room, if you stuck your head out of the window 3 foot. The room was of a good size and standard and clean but you would expect that from a 4 star. However the reception were not very helpful and were only interested in selling us expensive tours, the breakfast was really good but evening prices were high and bar prices for a drink were to.  There are quite a few places just around the corner to eat and drink at which are half the price of the hotel. Get a Roma Pass for 20Euro, you can use the public transport for 3 days for free and you get 2 entries and discounts to museums.  Buses run from the corner of the street, take the number 64 to Piazza Venezia and from there you can walk…

title: Beautiful city
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: great place
review: We stayed at the Star Hotel Michelangelo - a wonderful hotel.  Great breakfasts; extremely clean - we really couldn't fault it.  The only small minus was that it was a good 10 minute walk to the centre, though it was a pleasant and varied route through some lovely shopping areas.  However, it had the bonus of being very quiet.  We felt extremely safe in Florence, even late at night.  We saw a lot of Florence on a "hop-on and hop-off" open top bus and did our own trip to Pisa by train. I would highly recommend both the city and the hotel.

title: Great Choice
review: As part of a tour, my husband and I stayed at the Starhotels Michelangelo for 2 nights - and were very pleased!  The rooms were spotless and was more 'North American' than some of the other hotels we stayed at in Italy.  It was equipped with TV (in the bedroom AND bathroom), mini bar, coffee machine, PPV with internet access plus slippers and robes.  Twin beds were joined to make a larger bed but was very comfortable.  For the tourist attractions, it was about a 30 - 35 minute walk.  All you needed to do was just turn left when you leave the hotel and follow the river down - very easy.  Buffet breakfast was included in the package.  The usual breads, croissants, cereal, fruits, cold cuts, bacon, eggs, etc.  A decent selection.  The service was friendly and helpful as well. …

title: Nice business hotel
review: After spending fours days in Rome, I spent three days in Florence and stayed at this hotel where I had a wonderful experience. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk from the trains and a 20-15 minute walk from the Duomo.   This hotel looks pretty plain from the outside but it is wonderful on the inside. The interior is beautiful and the front desk was incredibly helpful. The rooms are very nice. They are spacious and modern, and the beds are very very comfortable.   Free breakfast is provided every morning. It was a great way to begin to the day. While the walk from the train and the Duomo is not too long, its a bit annoying after a long day of sightseeing. It appears that several buses stop in front of the hotel but we didnt take any of them.  Even though this was a wonderful…

title: Comfortable but lacks atmosphere
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence.
